constitute a separate offense    12131993 mobile homes mobile home parks and mobile home subdivisions article i  in general definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning mobile home means any vehicle without motive power used or so manufactured or constructed as will permit the vehicle to be conveyed or used as a conveyance upon the public streets and highways and so designed constructed or reconstructed as will permit the vehicle to be used as a place for human habitation by one or more persons but shall also include any such vehicle with motive power not registered as a motor vehicle in the state this definition shall include modular homes mobile home accessory building or structure means any awning cabana ramada storage structure carport fence windbreak or porch established for the use of the occupant of the mobile home upon a mobile home space mobile home park means any site lot field or tract of land under one ownership upon which two or more occupied mobile homes are harbored either free of charge or for revenue purposes and shall include any building structure tent vehicle or enclosure used or intended for use as part of the equipment of such mobile home park the term mobile home park shall not be construed to include mobile homes buildings tents or other structures temporarily maintained by any individual educational institution or company on their own premises and used exclusively to house their own labor or students mobile home space means a designated portion of a mobile home park designed for the accommodation of one mobile home and its accessory buildings or structures for the exclusive use of the occupants mobile home subdivision means a grouping of mobile homes on not less than 20 acres of contiguous area where each mobile home unit rests on a lot of separate ownership the lots shall have been properly subdivided in accordance with chapter 20 travel trailer means a towed recreational vehicle up to 35 feet in length and a maximum of eight feet wide  penalty for violation of chapter any person violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall be deemed guilty of a municipal infraction and upon conviction thereof shall be punished accordingly  compliance with chapter it shall be unlawful for any person to allow any premises owned or occupied by him to be used in violation of the terms of this chapter a violation of this chapter by the occupant of a mobile home shall raise the presumption that such violation was consented to by the person owning or occupying the premises  parking of mobile homes it shall be unlawful for any person to park any mobile home 1 on any street or other public place within the corporate limits of the city for a period of time in excess of two hours and then only between the hours of sunrise and sunset with the direction of the police operations division 2 for more than 48 hours on the premises of one occupied dwelling or business building or more than 24 hours on any lot which is not a part of the premises of any occupied dwelling or business building except in a mobile home park or mobile home subdivision  occupation of mobile home outside of park or subdivision a mobile home may be parked and occupied outside a mobile home park or subdivision only in the following instances 1 if the mobile home is used in conjunction with a construction project and not for living purposes 2 if the mobile home is used in the rendition of a public service 3 if the mobile home is used by public authorities in emergencies 4 if the mobile home is used as onlot temporary housing for an owner and family while the owners substantially damaged residence is being reconstructed for occupancy the occupancy must have prior approval by the city council and shall be subject to the following considerations a all property owners in the subdivision wherein the owners lot is located shall consent by signed petition to the temporary housing b all property owners not within the subdivision but within 330 feet of the proposed onlot utilization shall consent by signed petition to the temporary housing c location of the mobile home for the temporary occupancy shall be satisfactory to the city council d satisfactory provisions shall be made for removal of the mobile home within two weeks of issuance of the occupancy approval for the reconstructed dwelling in no case shall the mobile home remain in excess of one year e provision of all public utility services such as water sewer and electric service shall be to the satisfaction of the city council 5 if the mobile home is provided by the federal emergency management agency to be used as onlot temporary housing for an owner and family whose residence has been substantially damaged due to a natural disaster that has been the subject of a presidential declaration a the occupancy must have prior approval by the city staff of the department of community development and shall be subject to the following considerations 1 the onlot temporary location of the mobile home is necessary because the owners residence is being reconstructed for occupancy a building permit for the reconstruction of the owners primary residence must be obtained within 30 days of the placement of the mobile home on the private lot 2 all owners of abutting properties to the proposed onlot utilization shall be given prior written notice the written notice shall be sent by regular mail and certified mail to the property owners last known address with no written objections received by the department of community development within ten days from the date of mailing if written objections by abutting property owners are received by the department of community development within ten days of the date of mailing the matter of the onlot temporary location of the mobile home shall be considered by the city council at the next regularly scheduled city council meeting if the applicant for the onlot temporary location of the mobile home obtains written consent from all abutting property owners city staff may grant the occupancy before the tenday waiting period expires 3 location and proper elevation of the mobile home for the temporary occupancy shall be satisfactory to the department of community development owner shall provide a site plan and an elevation survey if necessary to city staff 4 provision of all public utility services such as water sewer and electric service shall be to the satisfaction of the department of community development 5 a signed contract between the owner and the city shall be executed prior to occupancy which shall include satisfactory provisions for the removal of the mobile home at the owners expense within two weeks of issuance of the occupancy approval for the reconstructed dwelling in no case shall the mobile home remain on the private lot in excess of 18 months b the provisions of subsection 5a1 of this section may be waived if there is substantial proof satisfactory to the city council that there are no other available sites for the mobile home to be located in any mobile home park or mobile home subdivision as determined by the federal emergency management agency in the event there is a request pursuant to this subsection the matter shall be considered by the city council at its next regularly scheduled city council meeting subsequent to the expiration of ten days from the date of mailing of notice to all abutting property owners    8182008 nonconforming mobile homes a generally mobile homes in existence at the time of the adoption of which are not located in a mobile home park or subdivision complying with this chapter are hereby declared to be nonconforming uses and such mobile homes shall not be enlarged extended reconstructed substituted or structurally altered when located outside a mobile home park or mobile home subdivision any mobile home in existence at the adoption of which was not an authorized nonconforming use under previous ordinances regulating mobile homes shall not be authorized to continue as a nonconforming use pursuant to this chapter or amendments thereto if such mobile home is damaged to an extent of more than 50 percent of its replacement value or the mobile home is removed from its present location it shall not thereafter be restored or placed in other than a mobile home park or mobile home subdivision if the nonconforming use of a mobile home is discontinued for a period of one year the mobile home must thereafter comply with the provisions of this chapter b permit required  contents of application all mobile homes declared by this section to be a nonconforming use must apply for and obtain a permit as a nonconforming use from the city clerk the application shall contain the following information 1 the street and number of the premises whereon the mobile home is located 2 the owner of the premises if other than the occupant of the mobile home 3 a site plan showing the proposed location of the mobile home on the lot 4 a statement of the nature and location of sanitary facilities used by the mobile home occupants 5 a statement that all wastewater from the mobile home is emptied into a proper sanitary sewer connected fixture 6 a statement that all garbage shall be disposed of in a sanitary manner 7 if rented a certificate of occupancy from the minimum housing code inspector c issuance of permit if the application required in subsection b of this section contains the necessary true information a permit shall be issued as a nonconforming use permit at no charge  minimum number of spaces in park or subdivision no mobile home park or subdivision nor any initial stage thereof shall contain less than 30 mobile home spaces  recreation areas in parks and subdivisions not less than eight percent of the gross area of every mobile home park or subdivision shall be developed as recreation areas easily accessible to all park residents recreation areas may include but are not limited to such facilities as recreation buildings adult recreation areas child play areas and swimming pools  drainage of parks and subdivisions each mobile home park or subdivision shall be located on a welldrained site properly graded to ensure drainage free from stagnant pools of water no sidewalks shall be used as drainageways drainage plans including retention areas shall be provided in accordance with city policy and the city engineers specifications  offstreet parking for parks and subdivisions each mobile home park and subdivision shall provide two offstreet parking spaces per mobile home space or mobile home lot each mobile home space or lot shall have two permanent concrete or asphalt surfaced offstreet automobile parking spaces with a minimum of 180 square feet per parking space the mobile home space or lot offstreet parking requirement may be included within the square foot requirements of the space or lot  screening in parks and subdivisions fences walls and plantings shall be required in mobile home parks and subdivisions to the extent needed to provide for adequate privacy and screening of objectionable views such as laundry drying yards garbage and trash collection stations nonresidential uses playgrounds and rear yards of adjacent properties  site maintenance for parks and subdivisions a covenant shall run with the land in favor of the city and all persons having a possessory interest in any portion of a mobile home park or subdivision that the owners of the park or subdivision or their successors in interest will maintain all private facilities such as interior streets parking areas sidewalks sewers and other utility services and plantings in compliance with city ordinances and the final development plan as approved by the city council  accessory buildings or structures all additions to mobile homes accessory buildings structures awnings cabanas carports basements and garages are subject to the building electrical plumbing fire and zoning codes of the city inspection shall be required permits obtained and associated permit fees paid in conformance with these or other applicable codes prior to occupancy by any person  conversion of mobile home  use for home occupation  certificate of occupancy required for rental no mobile home shall be converted regardless of the lot area nor shall any mobile home be utilized for a home occupation unless it meets the requirements for a home occupation as defined by the zoning chapter if rented the mobile home shall have a certificate of occupancy from the minimum housing code inspector  secs 14151431  reserved article ii  mobile home parks development procedures a submission of preliminary plan the owner of any tract of land comprising an area of not less than 20 acres wishing to develop a mobile home park shall submit to the city official and maintained as a permanent part of the records of the city  state licenses required prior to issuance of occupancy permit any owner of any mobile home park shall obtain all required state licenses prior to issuance of an occupancy permit by the city for any lot space or accessory structure  identification map  lot numbers a a logical and systematic method shall be used in preparing an identification map of all mobile home spaces streets and service buildings located in a mobile home park this map shall meet the requirements of the fire operations division and be filed as a permanent part of its records b lot numbers a minimum of three inches in height shall be placed on a post a minimum of four feet in height the posts being located in a systematic manner consistently on each space throughout the mobile home park  utilities each mobile home space in a mobile home park shall be provided with utility connections for water sanitary sewer and electricity the construction of all utilities including telephone street lighting and television wires and cables shall be in compliance with applicable ordinances and utilities shall be installed entirely underground by the developer thereof in accordance with the rules regulations and specifications of the public utility or agency providing such service  lighting walkways and roadways in a mobile home park shall be properly maintained and shall be lighted at night to provide an average maintained horizontal illumination of 04 footcandle in all walkway and roadway areas  streets and sidewalks a each mobile home site in a mobile home park shall have direct access to a street which is constructed in accordance with city specifications for residential streets and which has a minimum width of not less than 22 feet on collector streets within the park or where onstreet parking is extensively utilized wider streets may be required these streets shall be maintained in good condition as provided for by section 1412 b common sidewalks shall be provided along all entrance streets and in areas of high pedestrian traffic such as in the vicinity of the community buildings and recreation facilities sidewalks shall be at least four feet wide and constructed in accordance with city specifications including specifications for handicapped ramps c individual walks shall be provided to connect all mobile home sites to common sidewalks to paved streets or to paved driveways or parking spaces connected to a paved street such individual walks shall be at least two feet wide and constructed of asphalt or portland cement concrete pavement  distance between structures  patios mobile homes in a mobile home park shall be so located on each space that there shall be at least a 20foot clearance between any mobile home and another mobile home or any principal building within the mobile home park accessory structures attached to mobile homes shall be considered an integral part of the mobile home in determining clearance requirements in addition each mobile home space shall be provided with a paved patio of at least 80 square feet accessory buildings may not be closer than five feet to a lot line or eight feet to a mobile home unit or other principal structure  lot area each mobile home lot area in a mobile home park shall not be less than 3500 square feet  lot setbacks individual lots in a mobile home park shall provide a minimum of a 20foot front yard tenfoot rear yard and fivefoot side yards  lot width and depth individual lots in a mobile home park shall not be less than 90 feet deep or 35 feet wide  accessory buildings and service connections to comply with applicable codes the accessory buildings and service connections of all mobile home units in a mobile home park shall be provided in accordance with applicable building plumbing electrical mechanical housing fire and gas codes permits and associated fees shall be required for all construction additions modifications and demolition where applicable by such codes or other codes  occupancy by travel trailers no place site lot or space shall be established or maintained for the occupancy of a travel trailer in a mobile home park except that a mobile home park or a portion of a mobile home park may be designated an approved area for travel trailers by the city in the approval process set out in this article no travel trailer shall occupy a mobile home space for 30 days or more without meeting the requirements of this section  secs 14441474  reserved article iii  mobile home subdivisions city planning and zoning commission six copies of a preliminary plan of the proposed development accompanied by a nonrefundable fee in such amount as established by the council from time to time the accessory to particular mobile home spaces and their proposed height use and exterior design 4 access drives 5 public streets abutting and within the proposed development 6 proposed location of public facilities 10 landscaping and planting areas 11 walls and fences 12 storage areas 13 development stages and timing of each 14 floodway and floodplain areas as shown by the federal insurance administration 15 storm protection shelters for occupants of the subdivision b approval of preliminary plan following the requirements for amendment to the zoning chapter the planning and zoning commission shall review the conformity of the proposed development with the standards of the comprehensive plan and with recognized principles of civic design land use planning and landscape architecture the commission may approve the plan as submitted or before approval may require that the applicant modify alter adjust or amend the plan as the commission deems necessary to the end that it preserves the intent and purpose of this article to promote public health safety morals and general welfare c submission of final plan or detailed site plan if the city council approves the preliminary plan the applicant shall submit six copies of a final development plan or detailed site plan accompanied by a nonrefundable fee in such amount as established by the city council from time to time the final development plan or detailed site plan shall indicate not less than one stage of the proposed development showing specifically and in detail the location of all items required on the solid waste receptacles sidewalks lighting facilities common buildings service buildings and storm shelters 9 landscaping plan 10 the location of utility easements lines and hydrants 11 the location of floodway and floodplain areas d submission of homeowners agreement the applicant shall also submit a draft homeowners agreement including a declaration of covenants conditions and restrictions articles of incorporation and bylaws for the homeowners association controlling all common areas if such means exist in the proposed site plan the agreement shall be prepared in accordance with the horizontal property act of the state e review by planning and zoning commission the final development or detailed site plan and homeowners agreement plan shall be reviewed by the commission for compliance with the preliminary plan after no more than 60 days the commission shall forward its recommendations to the city council after final approval by the council a plan of the district shall be and zoning commission and city council may approve the plats owners dedication and homeowners agreements as submitted or before approval may require that the applicant modify alter adjust or amend the materials as the planning and zoning commission and city council deem necessary to the end that it preserves the intent and purpose of this article to promote the public health safety morals and general welfare the preliminary and final plats shall be exempt from the processing fees required by chapter 18 if fees have previously been paid for preliminary plan and final development or detailed site plan approval g installation of improvements before the final plat of the subdivided area shall be approved and recorded the subdivider shall make and install the improvements required in the detailed site plan and preliminary plan in accordance with the construction plans approved by the city engineer if the improvements have not been constructed inspected and certified complete by the city engineer then the subdivider shall enter into a contract with the city to ensure completion of the improvement within a specific time the performance of such contract shall be secured by the filing of a bond or cash to be approved by the council the bond or cash shall not be less than the appropriate cost of the improvements as estimated by the city engineer  identification map a logical and systematic method shall be used in preparing an identification map of all mobile home lots streets and service buildings located in a mobile home subdivision this map shall meet the requirements of the fire operations division and be filed as a permanent part of its records  utilities each mobile home lot in a mobile home subdivision shall be provided with utility connections for natural or lp gas public water public sanitary sewer and electricity the construction of all utilities including telephone street lighting and television wires and cables shall be in compliance with applicable ordinances and utilities shall be installed entirely underground by the developer thereof in accordance with the rules regulations and specifications of the public utility or agency providing such service  lighting private walkways and roadways in a mobile home subdivision shall be properly maintained and shall be lighted at night to provide an average maintained horizontal illumination of 04 footcandle in all walkway and roadway areas public streets and sidewalks shall be lighted in accordance with the rules regulations and specifications of the city and public utilities  streets and sidewalks a each mobile home lot in a mobile home subdivision shall have direct access to a public street which is constructed in accordance with city specifications for residential streets b public sidewalks shall be provided along all streets sidewalks shall be at least four feet wide and constructed in accordance with city specifications including specifications for handicapped ramps c all driveways and curb openings shall be constructed in accordance with the city engineers specifications and in accordance with chapter 19  distance between structures mobile homes in a mobile home subdivision shall be so located on each lot that there shall be at least a 20foot clearance between any mobile home and another mobile home or any principal building within the mobile home park accessory structures attached to mobile homes shall be considered an integral part of the mobile home in determining clearance requirements accessory buildings may not be closer than five feet to a lot line or eight feet to a mobile home unit or other principal structure  lot area each mobile home lot area in a mobile home subdivision shall not be less than 5000 square feet  lot setbacks individual lots in a mobile home subdivision shall provide a minimum of a 20foot front yard a tenfoot rear yard and side yards equal to ten percent of the lot width with no side yard less than five feet on any one side corner lots shall provide front yard setbacks on both street sides  lot width and depth individual lots in a mobile home subdivision shall not be less than 90 feet deep or 50 feet wide at the building line each lot shall have at least 40 feet of street frontage  service connections all lot services in a mobile home subdivision shall be provided in accordance with applicable building plumbing electrical mechanical housing fire and gas codes  occupancy by travel trailers no place site lot or space shall be established or maintained for the occupancy of a travel trailer in a mobile home subdivision  nuisances article i  in general public nuisances prohibited  authority to abate the creation or maintenance of a nuisance is unlawful and is prohibited the mayor or the mayors designee is authorized to abate nuisances either by issuance of a municipal infraction punishable as provided in section 19c10 or by administrative abatement procedures set forth in this article    5292007 nuisance defined  certain acts conditions declared as nuisances whatever is injurious to the senses or an obstruction to the free use of property so as essentially to interfere with the comfortable enjoyment of life or property by the public or community shall be deemed a nuisance nuisances shall include but shall not be limited to the following 1 the erecting continuing or using of any building or other place for the exercise of any trade employment or manufacture which by occasioning noxious exhalations offensive smells or other annoyances becomes injurious and dangerous to the health comfort or property of individuals or the public 2 the causing permitting or allowing of any refuse solid waste garbage noxious substances hazardous wastes junk or salvage materials to be collected or to remain in any place the term noxious substances includes but is not limited to substances solid or fluid which are offensive detrimental to health hurtful or dangerous including any dead animal or portion thereof together with human or animal excrement 3 the causing preventing or allowing any refuse solid waste garbage noxious substances or hazardous wastes junk salvage material or other offensive substances to be thrown left or deposited in or upon any street avenue alley sidewalk park public square lot whether vacant or occupied or upon any pond or pool of water 4 the obstructing or impeding without legal authority of the passage of any navigable river harbor or collection of water 5 creating maintaining causing or allowing to exist any stagnant water standing on any property including any container or material kept in such a condition that water can accumulate and stagnate therein 6 the corrupting or rendering unwholesome or impure of the water of any river stream or pond or unlawfully diverting the river stream or pond from its natural course or state to the injury or prejudice of others 7 creating maintaining causing or allowing to exist any ditch drain or watercourse which is now or hereafter may be constructed so as to prevent or unduly interfere with the surface and overflow water drainage from adjacent lands or any stormwater detention basin not properly maintained as determined by the city engineer 8 facilities for the storage or processing of sewage such as septic tanks cesspools and drain fields which have failed or do not function properly or which are overflowing leaking or emanating odors  or septic tanks cisterns and cesspools which are abandoned or no longer in use unless properly emptied and filled with clean fill  or any cesspool or septic tank which does not comply with the county department of health regulations 9 the obstructing or encumbering by fences buildings structures signs or otherwise of the public roads private ways streets alleys commons landing places or burying grounds 10 any gathering of persons or vehicles upon a public street or sidewalk or any use of property abutting a public street or hole or depression upon a finding by the court that the owner of the lot or parcel of land has violated the provisions of this subsection the lot owner shall be required to fill in any such excavation utilized in the daily operation of the commercial use must be stored in structures totally enclosed by structural walls roof and properly functioning doors 31 all structures both commercial and residential including detached accessory structures on any commercial residential agricultural or industrial property shall be free from significant structural defects the term free from significant structural defect means a the roof and roofing material are of such a nature and condition that they do not permit water snow or ice to penetrate into the structure roofing materials shall be in good condition and made up of consistent materials and consistent coloration throughout the roof area b drainage gutters and downspouts are securely attached to the structure and in proper functioning order c all exterior trim and exterior exposed surfaces including siding materials must be sound in good condition and securely attached to the structure d exterior walls must be free of holes and made of a consistent material such that patches or repairs consisting of dissimilar materials or colors compared to the prevailing surface material of the exterior walls are not present e the foundation of the structure is sound capable of supporting the structure and not deteriorated to the point that failure is judged to be inevitable but not necessarily imminent the foundation shall be plumb and free from cracks breaks and holes so as to prevent the entry of animals f windows and doors including outer screen or storm windows and doors must be intact containing no holes squarely hung with properly operating latches or locks so as to be securely closed and where the windows have intact glass or normal window material that allows the entry of light with no holes in said window surface areas g all points of egressingress into and out of the structure must be of a secure and safe design and made of standard building materials and must also provide clear and easy access via properly installed steps porches entryway landings and hand rails that are intact with no protruding or loose boards or surface materials causing a hazard and which provide ready access to all points of entry to the structure h exterior wall surfaces are properly painted andor maintained with appropriate exterior wall materials including wood vinyl steel or metal siding materials stucco or exterior insulation finish system eifs materials brick or similar masonry materials that are in all cases intact not in a condition of deterioration are of uniform coloration and are not patched with dissimilar materials plastic wrap material shall not be considered to be an acceptable siding material no flaking or chipped paint or outer loose material dominates or detracts from the exterior appearance of the structure i all fencing including gates shall be maintained in good condition free from damage breaks holes or missing structural members all fencing shall be of consistent materials and coloration j detached accessory structures including garages and storage sheds must conform to the standards outlined above in addition all doors and windows must be of functional design and materials and in proper working order no plastic wrap material or tarps shall be used to substitute for doorways or windows k all exterior wires which are hanging or unsecured on the exterior of the structure must be fastened to the structure in order to avoid life safety issues l reconstruction and repair materials and practices used in the reconstructionrepair of any building structure whether of roofing materials siding materials foundation walls windows doorways entryways or detached accessory structures shall be of standard quality and appearance consistent with currently applicable international building consistent with the appearance and character of the structure under repair and consistent with other properties in the immediate vicinity of the premises m vacant structures all vacant structures shall comply with the abovecited maintenance provisions with the exception that windows and doors may be secured with boards or other materials intended to provide security and protection to the structure all vandalized portions of the structure must be promptly repaired including repainting of areas that are defaced with paint or graffiti 32 all real property defaced by 26177e17    5292007   9192016   632019 additional conditions subject to chapter the requirement of the removal correction or abatement of nuisances enumerated in this chapter shall not be confined to the things known to the common law or specially declared by law as nuisances but shall also extend to anything constituting a nuisance in fact including as well anything designated in this judicially declared as dangerous offensive unhealthy or obstructive    5292007 responsibility for abatement  abatement defined a the owner agent lessee occupant or other person in charge of any building or premises where any of the things forbidden by this chapter exist or whence any of such things have originated or any person responsible for the existence origin or continuance of any of such things shall correct remove or abate such thing without delay b abatement may include but not be limited to repair removal cleaning extermination cutting mowing grading draining securing repairing a building or structure boarding unoccupied buildings barricading or fencing removing dangerous portions of buildings or structures and demolition of dangerous structures or abandoned buildings    5292007 abatement by city after notice  procedure  payment of costs a in case of the failure of any person to correct remove or abate a nuisance on written notice issued by the mayor or the mayors designee served in the manner of an original notice or by certified mail to the last known address of the owner agent lessee occupant or other person in charge of the building or premises where the nuisance exists and designating the time allowed for such removal correction or abatement the time thus allowed depending on the urgency of the case then and at once upon such failure the mayor or the mayors designee shall cause the nuisance to be summarily removed corrected or abated and the mayor or the mayors designee chief of police and such other officers as may be directed by the city council or mayor or the mayors designee therefor shall have the power at all times during the daytime to enter into and upon the premises and make thorough examination thereof for the purpose of ascertaining its sanitary conditions or the existence of nuisances therein and to do whatever may be necessary to remove correct or abate such nuisances b whenever the owner occupant or agent of any premises upon which any nuisance is found is unknown or cannot be found then the nuisance may be abated without notice c emergency abatement procedure when the mayor or the mayors designee determines that a nuisance exists on a property and constitutes an imminent and compelling danger to health safety or welfare of persons or property the mayor or the mayors designee is authorized to abate or have abated the nuisance without prior notice and opportunity of hearing the cost of any such emergency abatement procedure may be assessed against the property for collection in the same manner as property taxes as set forth in subsection d of this section however prior to such assessment the city shall first provide the property owner or other responsible person an opportunity to appear and be heard as provided in section 156 d whenever any nuisance is found on any premises and is abated under the provisions of this chapter or any other ordinance the city officers shall report to the council a detailed statement of the costs thereof which shall be paid in the first instance by the city together with a description of the premises in or upon which the nuisance was found and the name of the owner or occupant of such premises if known the city shall either institute an action in the name of the city against the owner tenant or other occupant of the premises for the recovery of the expenses incurred in abating such nuisance or if the city council so directs the expense of abatement shall be assessed upon the premises chargeable therewith and become a lien thereon or the city may both institute such an action and assess a lien against the property the city clerk shall thereupon certify for taxation purposes and for purposes of the establishment of a property lien to the county treasurer all such abatement costs together with an administrative expense of $500 to be collected in the same manner as a property tax e costs of abatement abatement costs shall include but shall not be limited to the cost of removing or eliminating the nuisance the cost of investigation such as title searches inspection and testing the costs of notification filing costs and other related administrative costs and any other costs or expenses incurred by the city in the abatement of the nuisance    5292007 abatement hearing  appeal any person ordered to abate a nuisance as provided in section 155 may have a hearing before the administration committee of the city council or such other person or committee as the administration committee may designate as to whether a nuisance exists and what steps must be taken to abate the nuisance a request for a hearing must be made in writing and delivered to the city clerk on or before the date stated in the notice of abatement issued by the city or it shall be conclusively presumed that a nuisance exists and that it must be abated as ordered within 14 days after the conclusion of the hearing the administration committee or its designee shall render a written decision as to whether a nuisance exists and shall notify the city and the appealing party of its decision by ordinary mail if the administration committee or its designee finds that a nuisance exists it shall include in the notification and order what steps must be taken to abate the nuisance and the time within which such steps must be taken    5292007 resisting obstructing or interfering with city officer any person who resists obstructs or otherwise interferes with any city officer who has been designated by the mayor or the mayors designee to enter upon and inspect any premises or to correct or abate any nuisance on such premises shall be guilty of a municipal infraction and shall be punished as provided in section 19    5292007 secs 1581532  reserved article ii  inoperable vehicles purpose it is hereby declared that the parking dismantling or storage of inoperable vehicles or vehicle parts upon public or private property within the corporate limits of the city is a threat to the public health welfare and safety and constitutes a nuisance    3122012 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning city means the city of cedar falls dismantle means to take apart  disassemble  tear down inoperable vehicle means any vehicle that has any one of the following characteristics 1 any vehicle that does not display current state registration 2 any vehicle with a broken or missing windshield missing window headlight or any other missing glass 3 any vehicle with a broken loose or missing fender door bumper hood roof steering wheel trunk lid muffler or tailpipe 4 any vehicle that is the habitat of rats mice snakes or any other vermin or insects 5 any vehicle that lacks an engine one or more wheels or other parts that render the vehicle inoperable such as a truck without an engine or a trailer missing a wheel 6 any vehicle that does not have all tires inflated 7 any vehicle that is not capable of moving in both forward and reverse gears 8 any vehicle trailer or semitrailer which contains stored gasoline or other fuel paper cardboard wood or other combustible materials garbage refuse solid waste debris or the like parking means the placement on public or private property of any vehicle or vehicle part for any period of time not exceeding 48 hours permit means to allow or fail to prevent person means any firm person partnership or corporation storage means the placement on public or private property of any vehicle or vehicle part for any consecutive period of time exceeding 48 hours vehicle means any implement of conveyance designed or used for the transportation of people or materials on land water or air including but not limited to automobiles trucks motorcycles snowmobiles boats airplanes helicopters tractors trailers campers motor homes wagons etc vehicle part means an individual component or subassembly of a vehicle    9192016 violation declared it shall be unlawful for any person to park dismantle or store any inoperable vehicle or vehicle part or to permit the parking dismantling or storage of any inoperable vehicle or vehicle part other than as herein provided by section 1543    3122012 owner of motor vehicle or vehicle parts prima facie responsible a the owner of any inoperable vehicle or vehicle part is prima facie responsible for the parking dismantling or storing of such vehicle or vehicle part upon public or private property in violation of this article any owner occupant or person in possession of real property within the city upon which one or more inoperable vehicles or vehicle parts are found is prima facie responsible for permitting such parking dismantling or storage of any inoperable vehicle or vehicle part upon such property in violation of this article no person shall be charged with more than one violation of this article for any one vehicle the owner of an inoperable vehicle or vehicle part and the owner of real estate upon which such inoperable vehicle or vehicle part are found may both be charged b each day the owner of an inoperable vehicle or vehicle part and the owner occupant or person in possession of real property within the city is found in violation of this article and permits the violation to continue after the notice period provided in section 1538 shall be a new violation of this article    3122012 notice a upon discovery of any inoperable motor vehicle or vehicle part stored upon private property within provisions of this article 2 the owner must abate the violation by removing or repairing same in accordance with the terms of section 1538 3 failure to remove or repair same shall be sufficient cause authorized under the zoning chapter of the city    3122012 secs 15441574  reserved article iii  noise definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning aweighted sound level means the total sound level of all sound as measured with a sound level meter using the a weighting network the unit of measurement is the decibel on the a weighting network which is abbreviated dba animal or fowl means any living creature domestic or wild retained by and associated with a dwelling or other premises as a pet or beast of labor or for other purposes which serve the wishes of the owner thereof bel means a unit of measure of sound level which is the logarithmic ratio of the power of the sound to be measured to the power of a reference standard the power is proportional to the square of the sound pressure the reference pressure is the internationally agreed reference level of  microbars the base of the logarithm is 10 use of the bel is restricted to sound levels of quantities proportional to power chief of police means the chief of police or his duly authorized agent cycle means the complete sequence of values of a periodic quantity that occur during a period decibel means onetenth of a bel and is determined as follows db   10 log 10 p x p o  2 where p x is the sound pressure level to be measured and p o is the international reference standard of p o    microbars emergency work means work made necessary to restore property to a safe condition following a public calamity or work required to protect persons or property from an imminent exposure to danger frequency of a function periodic in time means the reciprocal of the primitive period the unit is the cycle per unit of time hertz and must be specified microbar means a unit of pressure commonly used in acoustics and is equal to one dyne per square centimeter motor vehicle means any passenger vehicle motorcycle motorassisted bicycle motordriven cycle truck truck trailer trailer or semitrailer propelled or drawn by motorized power or any powered motor vehicle noise means unwanted sound undesired sound or sound without value noise consists of any sound independent of loudness that may produce physiological or psychological damage or interference with the social ends of an individual or group such ends to include all of mans activities including communication work rest recreation and sleep noise rating number means the dba scale reading as applicable to specific sound sources period of a periodic quantity is the smallest increment of time for which the function repeats itself periodic quantity means an oscillating quantity the values of which recur for equal increments of time pure tone means any sound which can be distinctly heard as a single pitch or a set of single pitches for the purposes of this article a pure tone shall exist if the onethird octave band sound pressure level in the band with the tone exceeds the arithmetic average of the sound pressure levels of the two contiguous onethird octave bands by five decibels for center frequencies of 500 hertz and above and by eight decibels for center frequencies between 160 and 400 hertz and by 15 decibels for center frequencies less than or equal to 125 hertz sound level meter means an instrument including a microphone an amplifier an output meter and frequency weighting networks for the measurement of noise and sound levels in a specified manner soundproducing device means a mechanical or electronic device the primary purpose of which is the creation of sound or amplification of sound to higher levels including without limitation a public address system music amplifier horn siren whistle or explosive vehicle means every device in upon or by which any person or property is or may be transported or drawn upon a street or highway except devices moved by human power or used exclusively upon stationary rails or tracks zoning district means the zoning districts as established by chapter 26  penalty for violation of article any person violating any provision of this article shall be deemed guilty of a municipal infraction and upon conviction thereof shall be subject to punishment as provided in section 19  violations declared nuisance each violation of this article shall constitute a public nuisance and shall be subject to abatement as such  exemptions from article a emergency operations emergency shortterm operations which are necessary to protect the health and welfare of the citizens such as emergency utility and street repair fallen tree removal or emergency fuel oil delivery shall be exempt from the criteria set forth in section 1585a provided that reasonable steps shall be taken by those in charge of such operations to minimize noise emanating from the operations b noise required for public safety the provisions of section 1585a shall not apply to any noise required specifically by law for the protection or safety of people or property c lawn mowers garden tools etc powered equipment such as lawn mowers small lawn and garden tools riding tractors and snow removal equipment which is necessary for maintenance and which equipment when new would not comply with the standards set forth in this article shall be exempted from the provisions of section 1585a no person shall operate such equipment with the exception of snow removal equipment during the hours of  pm am inclusive d residential air conditioners noise emitted by residential air conditioners shall be judged by the criteria set forth in section 1588 e aircraft operations aircraft operations which are controlled specifically by federal law and enforcement shall be exempted from the provisions of this article f disturbing the peace noise created by human behavior and generally considered to be disturbing the peace shall be exempted from the provisions of this article g bells chimes and similar devices bells chimes and similar devices which signal the time of day and operate during the daytime hours for a duration of no longer than five minutes in any given onehour period shall be exempt from the noise limitations of section 1585a  applicability of other laws this article shall not be deemed to supersede or repeal other existing ordinances or laws which are designed to control public nuisances or disturbances such as noise  enforcement of article it shall be the duty of the chief of police or designee to enforce the provisions of this article    632019 variance permits a permitted activities  issuance variance permits may be issued by the chief of police to exceed the noise standards set forth in this article as follows 1 temporary variance permits a a temporary variance permit may be issued upon request provided that the work producing such noise is necessary to promote the public health or welfare and that reasonable steps are taken to keep such noise at the lowest possible practical level b a temporary variance permit may be issued for special events such as circuses 4th of july celebrations and similar community events which are limited in duration and are generally acceptable to people of the community provided that precautions are taken to maintain the noises produced at the lowest practical level c applications for temporary variance permits must be made in writing to the chief of police and shall contain all the following pertinent information 1 the dates requested  2 the time and place of operation  3 the equipment and operation involved  4 the necessity for such permit  5 the steps to be taken to minimize noise  and 6 the name of the responsible person who will be present at the operation site while the noise is produced 2 variance permits for existing businesses a it is recognized that it is not technically or economically feasible for certain business operations and equipment to comply with the standards set forth in this article as of  the chief of police shall therefore issue a variance permit for business operations and equipment in existence on such date which produce excessive noise if it is found that it is not technically or economically feasible to alter such operation to reduce noise to within the prescribed standards set forth in this article applications for such variances must be made to the chief of police by an affected party in a letter setting forth the reasons that such variance should be granted the chief of police after review of all circumstances and the degree of nuisance shall reply in writing giving the variance denying the variance or setting forth conditions or limitations under which the variance will be granted variance permits granted under this subsection shall be valid for a period of one year from the date granted and may be renewed for a like period of time upon application and review b if the chief of police issues an order citing a violation of this article on a business operation and equipment in existence on  and the party cited applies for a variance within ten days of such citation then all penalties provided shall be tolled from the date the application is filed until a final order or decision has been issued on the merits of the application 3 exemption a variance permit shall not be required for school university or community events such as athletic contests and music concerts which are performed on a regular basis and are generally acceptable to the people of the city  provided that precautions are taken to maintain the noise produced at the lowest practical level this provision does not apply to rock music concerts b revocation any variance permit granted under the terms of this section may be revoked prior to the expiration of the permit if it is determined by the chief of police that the permit holder is violating any of the provisions of the variance permit or is exceeding any variances granted in the permit c appeal of denial any person who has been denied a variance permit by the chief of police may appeal the decision of the chief of police directly to the city council within ten days of the denial of the permit the appeal should be in writing and directed to the city council  permit to use soundproducing device any person who desires to use a soundproducing device which would create a noise level higher than that permitted by this article must first apply for a permit from the city council the city council may issue such a permit if it is satisfied that the use for which the permit is desired will not endanger the health safety and comfort of the general public of the city  general noises prohibited a standards for determination of violation it shall be unlawful for any person to permit make continue or cause any excessive or unusually loud noise or any noise which annoys disturbs injures or endangers the comfort repose health peace or safety of reasonable people within the limits of the city the standards which shall be considered in determining whether a violation exists shall include the following 1 the sound pressure level of the noise 2 whether the origin of the noise is natural or manmade 3 the sound pressure level of the background noise 4 the proximity of the noise to residential sleeping facilities 5 the nature and zoning of the area within which the noise emanates 6 the time of the day or night the noise occurs 7 whether the noise is recurrent intermittent or constant b specific acts or conditions prohibited each of the following acts among others is hereby declared to be in violation of this article and is prohibited the following enumerated acts shall not be construed as limiting or precluding enforcement of any other provisions of this article 1 unnecessary sounding of horns or signaling devices the sounding of any horn or signaling device on any automobile motorcycle bus or other vehicle on any street or public place of the city except as a danger or alerting signal and the sounding of any such device for an unnecessary and unreasonable period of time 2 loud operation of radios phonographs etc the using operating or permitting to be placed used or operated of any radio receiving set musical instrument phonograph or other machine or device for the producing or reproducing of sound in such manner as to disturb the peace quiet and comfort of reasonable people 3 use of loudspeakers or amplifiers for advertising the using operating or permitting to be played used or operated of any radio receiving set musical instrument phonograph loudspeaker sound amplifier or other machine or device for producing or reproducing of sound which is broadcast upon the public streets for the purpose of commercial advertising or attracting the attention of the public to any structure or event 4 keeping noisy animals and fowl the keeping upon any premises owned occupied or controlled by any person of any animal or fowl otherwise permitted to be kept which by any sound or cry shall cause annoyance or discomfort to a reasonable person of normal sensibilities 5 operation of defective or improperly loaded vehicle the use of any automobile motorcycle or vehicle so out of repair or so loaded in such manner as to create loud and unnecessary grating grinding rattling or other noise 6 excessive noise in loading or unloading the creation of a loud and excessive noise in connection with loading or unloading any vehicle or the opening and destruction of bales boxes crates and containers 7 creation of noise near schools courts churches or hospitals the creation of loud and excessive noise on any street adjacent to any school institution of learning church or court while the school institution church or court is in use or adjacent to any hospital which unreasonably interferes with the workings of such institution or which disturbs or unduly annoys patients in the hospital 8 use of drums or other instruments to attract attention the use of any drum or other instrument or device for the purpose of attracting attention by creation of noise to any performance show sale or event this subsection shall not apply to a drum used in an authorized parade in the city 9 construction or repair of buildings structures and streets during certain hours the erection including excavation demolition alteration or repair of any building structure or street other than between the hours of  am and  pm monday except in case of urgent necessity in the interest of public health and safety and then only with a permit from the director of community development or the director of public works or their authorized agent which permit may be granted for a period not to exceed three days or less while the emergency continues and which permit may be renewed for periods of three days or less while the emergency continues if the director of community development or the director of public works or their authorized agent should determine that the public health and safety will not be impaired by the erection demolition alteration or repair of any building or the excavation of streets and highways within the hours of  pm and  am and if he shall further determine that loss or inconvenience would result to any interested party he may grant permission for such work to be done within the hours of  pm and  am upon application being made at the time the permit for the work is awarded or during the progress of the work this subsection will not apply to the performance of necessary emergency work pneumatic hammer derrick power hoist or other construction equipment such equipment shall at all times be equipped with an effective muffling device 11 repairing vehicle during certain hours the be subject to the levels outlined in section 1581    632019 group noise when a group of persons act together to create noise each individual shall be deemed responsible as though solely the principal person producing the resultant noise  noise limitations by use district a noise limitations at the lot line of any premises located in the various use districts are as follows noise limit dba any residence district 55 any commercial district 60 light industrial 65 heavy industrial or unclassified 65 b pure tone and impulsive noises are factors in determination of noise five dba shall be subtracted from the limits set out in subsection a of this section if the subject noise consists primarily of a pure tone or if it is impulsive in character  method of measuring noise a equipment noise measurements shall be made with a sound level meter type 1 or type 2 manufactured according to the specifications of the american national standards institute usa standard specification for general purpose sound level meters s141971 and preferred center frequencies for acoustical measurements s161960 or any subsequent nationally adopted standard superseding such standards b location and interpretation of measurements noise measurements shall be made at the nearest lot line of premises from which a noise complaint is received and shall be made at a height of at least three feet above the ground and at least three feet away from walls barriers obstructions or soundreflective surfaces where the nature of the noise permits the slow response setting shall be used to obtain the noise level on the sound level meter  vibrations any vibration that can be felt beyond the property line in any zoning district whether manufacturing business commercial or residential is in violation of this article and no instrument is needed to make a determination of the vibration  noise emitted by residential air conditioners a noise limits no person shall install operate or use any residential air conditioner or combination of residential air conditioners which creates a noise level at the lot line of any dwelling unit located on any adjacent premises in excess of the noise limitations listed in section 1585 b measurement upon receiving a complaint the chief of police shall conduct a noise survey of a sound level meter as provided in section 1586 the sound pressure level shall be measured at the lot line of the premises with the sound level measuring microphone placed at such point at or near the lot line in the most reasonable proximity to the noise source results of this survey shall be compared to the maximum permissible levels as set forth in section 1585a if the levels found in the survey exceed the level of the dba rating the noise shall be deemed as excessive and in violation of this section  noise from motor vehicles a noise limits no person shall operate a motor vehicle or a combination of motor vehicles at any time or under any condition of grade load acceleration or deceleration in such a manner as to exceed the following noise limits for the category of motor vehicle based on the following distances from the centerline of travel on a street or highway or from a location at rest under test procedures established in this section vehicle class distance from centerline speed limit noise limit dba any motor vehicle licensed for ten tons or more and any combination of vehicles towed by such vehicle not less than 48 feet and not more than 58 feet 35 mph or less 88 any motor vehicle licensed for ten tons or more and any combination of vehicles towed by such vehicle not less than 48 feet and not more than 58 feet over 35 mph 92 any motor vehicle including passenger cars motorcycles and any combination of motor vehicles towed by such vehicles not less than 30 feet all speeds 80 b measurement sound level measurement for the noise levels set out in subsection a of this section shall be made with a sound level meter using the aweighted scale in accordance with those standards promulgated by the society of automotive engineers of the american national standards institute c right to additional test where a motor vehicle is deemed to be in violation of this section the owner thereof may transport it to a central testing location the location to be determined by the chief of police where such vehicle may be tested under normal operating conditions for further evaluation if the vehicle is reevaluated and found not to be in violation of the decibel standards as outlined no further proceedings shall be instituted and any citation issued shall be dismissed  sale or rental of equipment not in compliance with noise standards no person shall sell offer distribute lease or rent any new or used vehicle device or equipment intended for use any federal or state standards which apply to such equipment and are intended to reduce or minimize the noise emission from such equipment  compliance with article in city operations a compliance by in the creation of noises which could be in violation of this article  offenses and miscellaneous provisions article i  in general assault a a person commits an assault when without justification the person does any of the following 1 any act which is intended to cause pain or injury to or which is intended to result in physical contact which will be insulting or offensive to another coupled with the apparent ability to execute the act  2 any act which is intended to place another in fear of immediate physical contact which will be painful injurious insulting or offensive coupled with the apparent ability to execute the act  or 3 intentionally points a firearm toward another or displays in a threatening manner any dangerous weapon toward another a provided that where the person doing any of the acts enumerated in this subsection and such other person are voluntary participants in a sport social or other activity not in itself criminal and such act is a reasonably foreseeable incident of such sport or activity and does not create an unreasonable risk of serious injury or breach of the peace the act shall not be an assault b provided that where the person doing any of the above enumerated acts is employed by a school district or accredited nonpublic school or is an area education agency staff member who provides services to a school or school district and intervenes in a fight or physical struggle or other disruptive situation that takes place in the presence of the employee or staff member performing employment duties in a school building on school grounds or at an official school function regardless of the location the act shall not be an assault whether the fight or physical struggle or other disruptive situation is between students or other individuals if the degree and the force of the intervention is reasonably necessary to restore order and to protect the safety of those assembled b a person who commits an act of assault other than those acts defined in iowa 215 commits a simple misdemeanor and shall be punished accordingly    10242005 harassment a a person commits harassment when with intent to intimidate annoy or alarm another person the person does any of the following 1 communicates with another by telephone telegraph writing or via electronic communication without legitimate purpose and in a manner likely to cause the other person annoyance or harm 2 places a simulated explosive or simulated incendiary device in or near a building vehicle airplane railroad engine or railroad car or boat occupied by another person 3 orders merchandise or services in the name of another or to be delivered to another without the other persons knowledge or consent 4 reports or causes to be reported false information to a law enforcement authority implicating another in some criminal activity knowing that the information is false or reports the alleged occurrence of a criminal act knowing the act did not occur b a person commits harassment when the person purposefully and without legitimate purpose has personal contact with another person with the intent to threaten intimidate or alarm that other person as used in this section unless the context otherwise requires the term personal contact means an encounter in which two or more people are in visual or physical proximity to each other personal contact does not require a physical touching or oral communication although it may include these types of contacts c any act of harassment other than those acts described in of iowa 72 and 3 is harassment in the third degree harassment in the third degree is a simple misdemeanor any person who commits harassment in the third degree shall be punished accordingly    10242005 obstructing traffic a it shall be unlawful for any person to congregate with another or others in or on any public way so as to halt the flow of vehicular or pedestrian traffic and to refuse to clear such public way when ordered by any law enforcement officer for the purpose of this section the term public way means the entire width between property lines of every way or place of whatever nature when any part thereof is open for the use of the public as a matter of right or privilege for purposes of vehicular or pedestrian traffic b any person violating the provisions of this section shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof shall be punished accordingly  311993 criminal mischief a it shall be unlawful for any person to commit an act of criminal mischief which consists of any damage defacing alteration or destruction of property when done intentionally by one who has no right to so act b whenever criminal mischief is committed upon more than one item of property at approximately the same location or time period so that all of these acts of mischief can be attributed to a single scheme plan or conspiracy such acts shall be considered as a single act of criminal mischief c criminal mischief is criminal mischief in the fifth degree if the cost of replacing repairing or restoring the property so damaged defaced altered or destroyed does not exceed $20000 criminal mischief in the fifth degree is a misdemeanor    10242005 trespass a the following words terms and phrases when used in this section shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection except where the context clearly any administrative building or offices of the railway corporation reasonable expectation of privacy means circumstances in which a reasonable person would believe that the person could disrobe or of the following acts a entering upon or in property without the express permission of the owner lessee or person in lawful possession with the intent to commit a public offense to use remove therefrom alter damage harass or place thereon or therein anything animate or inanimate or to hunt fish or trap on or in the property including the act of taking or attempting to take a deer other than a farm deer as defined in iowa 1 or preserve whitetail as defined in iowa c1 which is on or in the property by a person who is outside the property this subsection does not prohibit the unarmed pursuit of game or furbearing animals by a person who lawfully injured or killed the game or furbearing animal which comes to rest on or escapes to the property of another b entering or remaining upon or in property without justification after being notified or requested to abstain from entering or to remove or vacate therefrom by the owner lessee or person in lawful possession or the agent or employee of the owner lessee or person in lawful possession or by any peace officer magistrate or public employee whose duty it is to supervise the use or maintenance of the property a person has received notice to abstain from entering or remaining upon or in property within the meaning of this subsection if any of the following is applicable 1 the person has been notified to abstain from entering or remaining upon or in property personally either orally or in writing including by a valid court order under iowa  2 a printed or written notice forbidding such entry has been conspicuously posted or exhibited at the main entrance to the property or the forbidden part of the property c entering upon or in property for the purpose or with the effect of unduly interfering with the lawful use of the property by others d being upon or in property and wrongfully using removing therefrom altering damaging harassing or placing thereon or therein anything animate or inanimate without the implied or actual permission of the owner lessee or person in lawful possession e entering or remaining upon or in railway property without lawful authority or without the consent of the railway corporation which owns leases or operates the railway property this subsection does not apply to passage over a railroad rightofway other than a track railroad roadbed viaduct bridge trestle or railroad yard by an unarmed person if the person has not been notified or requested to abstain from entering on to the rightofway or to vacate the rightofway and the passage over the rightofway does not interfere with the operation of the railroad 2 the term trespass shall not mean either of the following a entering upon the property of another for the sole purpose of retrieving personal property which has accidentally or inadvertently been thrown fallen strayed or blown onto the property of another provided that the person retrieving the property takes the most direct and accessible route to and from the property to be retrieved quits the property as quickly as possible and does not unduly interfere with the lawful use of the property this subsection does not apply to public utility property where the person has been notified and requested by posted signage or other means to abstain from entering b entering upon the rightofway of a public road or highway b this section shall not apply to the following persons 1 representatives of the state department of transportation the federal railroad administration or the national transportation safety board who enter or remain upon or in railway property while engaged in the performance of official duties 2 employees of a railway corporation who enter or remain upon or in railway property while acting in the course of employment 3 any person who is engaged in the operation of a lawful business on railway station grounds or in the railway depot 4 representatives of the state utilities board the federal energy regulatory commission or the federal communications commission who enter or remain upon or in public utility property while engaged in the performance of official duties 5 employees of a public utility who enter or remain upon or in public utility property while acting in the course of employment c any person who knowingly trespasses upon the property of another commits a simple misdemeanor and shall be punished accordingly    10242005 false reports to or communications with public safety entities a a person who reports or causes to be reported false information to a fire department a law enforcement person commits theft when the person does any of the following 1 takes possession or control of the property of another or property in the possession of another with the intent to deprive the other thereof 2 misappropriates property which the person has in trust or property of another which the person has in the persons possession or control whether such possession or control is lawful or unlawful by using or disposing of it in a manner which is inconsistent with or a denial of the trust or of the owners rights in such property or conceals found property or appropriates such property to the persons own use when the owner of such property is known to the person a failure by a bailee or lessee of personal property to return the property within 72 hours after a time specified in a written agreement of lease or bailment shall be evidence of misappropriation b if a time is not specified in the written agreement of lease or bailment for the expiration or termination of the lease or bailment or for the return of the personal property failure by a lessee or bailee to return the property within five days after proper notice to the lessee or bailee shall be evidence of misappropriation for the purposes of this subsection the term proper notice means a written notice of the expiration or termination of the lease or bailment agreement sent to the lessee or bailee by certified or restricted certified mail at the address of the lessee or bailee specified in the agreement the notice shall be considered effective on the date of the mailing of the notice regardless of whether or not the lessee or bailee signs a receipt for the notice 3 obtains the labor or services of another or a transfer of possession control or ownership of the property of another or the beneficial use of property of another by deception where compensation for goods and services is ordinarily paid immediately upon the obtaining of such goods or the rendering of such services the refusal to pay or leaving the premises without payment or offer to pay or without having obtained from the owner or operator the right to pay subsequent to leaving the premises gives rise to an inference that the goods or services were obtained by deception 4 exercises control over stolen property knowing such property to have been stolen or having reasonable cause to believe that such property has been stolen unless the persons purpose is to promptly restore it to the owner or to deliver it to an appropriate public officer the fact that the person is found in possession of property which has been stolen from two or more persons on separate occasions or that the person is a dealer or other person familiar with the value of such property and has acquired it for a consideration which is far below its reasonable value shall be evidence from which the court or jury may infer that the person knew or believed that the property had been stolen 5 takes destroys conceals or disposes of property in which someone else has a security interest with intent to defraud the secured party 6 makes utters draws delivers or gives any check share draft draft or written order on any bank credit union person or corporation and obtains property the use of property including rental property or service in exchange for such instrument if the person knows that such check share draft draft or written order will not be paid when presented a whenever the drawee of such instrument has refused payment because of insufficient funds and the maker has not paid the holder of the instrument the amount due thereon within ten days of the makers receipt of notice from the holder that payment has been refused by the drawee the court or jury may infer from such facts that the maker knew that the instrument would not be paid on presentation notice of refusal of payment shall be by certified mail or by personal service in the manner prescribed for serving original notices b whenever the drawee of such instrument has refused payment because the maker has no account with the drawee the court or jury may infer from such fact that the maker knew that the instrument would not into the body any intoxicating substance nor shall any person be intoxicated however the provisions of this section shall not apply to any person who inhales breathes drinks or otherwise takes into the body any intoxicating substance pursuant to the direction of any authorized doctor physician surgeon dentist or podiatrist  sale purchase or possession for unlawful purpose no person shall buy
