city 1 that portion of the city lying south of the cedar river shall have the river as the dividing line for main street and all streets parallel thereto main street shall be the dividing line for all streets running east and west and transversely thereto 2 main street and all streets parallel thereto south of the cedar river shall be so numbered that all buildings in the first block shall be numbered over 100 and less than 200 and numbers shall rise by 100 for each consecutive block to the south limits of the city 3 all streets intersecting main street shall be termed west by their respective names in that portion of the city lying west of main street and south of the cedar river and in the portion of the city lying east of main street and south of the river they shall be termed east by their respective names 4 the buildings on the streets running transversely to main street shall be so numbered on either side of main street that the buildings within the blocks next to main street shall be numbered over 100 and less than 200 and numbers shall rise by 100 for each consecutive block to the east and west limits of the city 5 that portion of the city lying north of the cedar river shall be numbered in a manner using the river and lincoln street as the dividing lines and shall be so numbered that the first block on lincoln street and all streets running parallel thereto shall be numbered over 100 and less than 200 and numbers shall rise by 100 for each block to the city limits 6 all streets intersecting and running transversely to lincoln street shall be termed north by their respective names for those portions north of lincoln street  those portions of such streets lying south of lincoln street shall be termed south by their respective names and shall be numbered in a manner similar to the method of numbering the intersecting streets on the south side of the river  numbering to commence at dividing lines  use of odd and even numbers except as otherwise provided the numbering of buildings shall commence at the dividing lines established in section 19246 and be so fixed across the streets from right to left that all odd numbers shall be on the right side and all even numbers on the left side  numbering on university avenue effective on  university avenue from the east city limits to the west city limits shall not be termed east or west and university avenue shall be numbered commencing at the east city limits with the number 4100 and the street shall be numbered consecutively with odd numbers on the south side of the street and even numbers on the north side of the street to the west city limits  effect of lot and building frontage each lot having a street frontage of 22 feet shall have a separate number and buildings having more than a 22foot frontage shall be numbered by the number to which the lot is entitled upon which the principal entrance to the building is located  determination of number in case of doubt in case of doubt as to the proper number for any building or lot subject to the provisions of this article the city engineer shall on request decide on the number  street number plats it shall be the duty of the city engineer to prepare and keep on file in his office a plat showing the streets and the numbers required under this article and whenever a plat is filed as an addition to the city the engineer shall file a copy of such plat with the city clerk showing the numbers as required under this article  placement of numbers required all owners or lessees of buildings on any of the streets of the city are hereby required to number their buildings in strict accordance with the provisions of this article and shall cause the number to be placed in plain view on their property and so maintained  standards for numbers the numbers used to number buildings shall be three inches high and two inches wide and made of metal or other substantial and durable material  placement of numbers by city if an owner or lessee neglects or refuses to number the property owned or occupied by him as required in this article for a period of ten days after being notified either personally or by public notice this affect any ordinance prescribing schedules for the development of specific and designated thoroughfares as prescribed in the capital improvements program and all such ordinances are hereby may be given by the council to conduct water over or under any sidewalk under the direction of the operations and maintenance manager violation of the provisions of this section shall constitute a municipal infraction and upon conviction thereof shall be punished in accordance with section 19  subdivisions article i  in general general provisions a short title this chapter shall be known as the subdivision ordinance of the city b purpose the purpose of this chapter is to provide minimum standards for the design development and improvement of all new subdivisions and resubdivisions of land so that existing land uses will be protected and so that adequate provisions are made for public facilities and services and so that growth occurs in an orderly manner consistent with the comprehensive plan and to promote the public health safety and general welfare of the citizens of the city c application every owner of any tract or parcel of land who has subdivided or shall hereafter subdivide or plat said tract or parcel into two or more parts for the purpose of laying out an addition subdivision building lot or lots acreage or suburban lots within the city shall cause plats of such area to be made in the form and containing the information as hereinafter set forth before selling any lots therein contained or placing the plat on record d subdivided land land to be subdivided shall be of such character that it can be used safely for building purposes without danger to health or peril from fire and flood and shall not be subdivided until adequate public utilities sanitary sewer streets and similar infrastructure and improvements exist or are satisfactorily provided to the property and to all building sites prior to building construction furthermore all such subdivisions shall to the extent that is practical protect and preserve important environmental features of the land as specified herein and shall provide effective stormwater runoff controls and soil erosion control features in a manner that minimizes flooding soil erosion waterway embankment erosion and contamination of water resources e recording of plat no subdivision plat resubdivision plat or street dedication within the city shall be filed for record with the county recorder or recorded by the county recorder until a final plat of such subdivision resubdivision or street dedication has been reviewed and approved in accordance with the provisions of this chapter f filing plat upon the approval of the final plat by the city council it shall be the duty of the subdivider to immediately file such plat with the county auditor and county recorder as required by law g request dely in those cases where the ownersubdivider requests a delay in referral of a subdivision plat from the planning and zoning commission to the city council such delay shall be allowed however if any plat whether a preliminary plat final plat or minor plat is delayed for referral from the planning and zoning commission to the city council for a period longer than one year from the date of review by the commission said plat shall be resubmitted in the original fashion including payment of platting fees and updated dates on the submitted plat city staff shall evaluate whether circumstances have changed with respect to details on the plat with respect to the property being subdivided or with respect to developments on nearby properties that may have an effect on the proposed plat if city staff feel that no changes are necessary regarding the proposed plat the matter may be referred directly to the city council with no further review by the planning and zoning commission h fees established the city council shall from time to time establish by resolution fees for the review of plats no plat for any subdivision or resubdivision shall be considered filed with the city clerk unless and until said plat is accompanied by the fee as established by resolution of the city council from time to time and as required by this chapter i lot sales before final plat approval no owner subdivider or other person representing or working on behalf of the owner shall dispose of or sell any lot or lots within the area of jurisdiction of this chapter before the final plat thereof has been approved by the city council and recorded as required by law any such lot sale or disposal prior to final plat approval shall result in forfeiture and payment of $30000 for each lot or part of lot sold or disposed nothing contained herein shall in any way limit the citys right to any other remedies available to the city for the enforcement of this chapter this provision shall not prevent marketing efforts to advertise or offer for sale such proposed lots subject to final plat approval j building permit to be denied no building permit shall be issued for new building construction on any lot parcel or tract where a subdivision is required by this chapter unless and until a final plat of such subdivision has been approved and recorded in accordance with this chapter and until all public infrastructure improvements required by this chapter have been accepted by the city unless a final plat has been approved in lieu of completion of required public improvements as specified herein    12132010 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them area developable parcel means one or more proposed lots parcels or land area that have sufficient area width and depth and are in a location where the potential for future new building construction is likely by virtue of an appropriate zoning classification for the property or likely zoning designation in the future the presence of street frontagestreet access or reasonable expectation of said street or roadway extension and ready immediate access to all basic municipal utility services basic municipal utility services include water gas electric communication and sanitary sewer services in addition to these considerations the presence or absence of environmentally sensitive land features may also influence the evaluation of whether the parcel in question is developable development or redevelopment means any manmade change to improved or unimproved real estate including but not limited to new building or construction of other structures mining dredging filling grading paving excavation or drilling operations easement means an authorization by a property owner for another entity or person to use a designated part of the owners property for a specified purpose environmental report means a graphic andor written summary of observed physical features on a parcel of land prepared by a person or firm with the background and credentials to perform such assessments and reports with particular attention paid towards natural topographic features such as steep slopes greater than 18 percent slope soils wetlands and related drainage areas of local streams or rivers floodplain areas floodways and important plant communities including significant tree stands the city engineer shall provide a list of preapproved firms to the subdivider judged to be qualified to prepare the environmental report the report must contain comments on the general characteristics of the subject property and where appropriate identification of important environmentally sensitive features on abutting property if protection measures on the subject property under consideration are necessary to protect the integrity of an important environmental feature on an abutting property said report shall recommend whether the site is suitable for development or if special measures need to be taken to protect identified environmentally sensitive land features on the subject property or if measures are necessary to protect such features on abutting properties with recommendations on the means to protect said features environmentally sensitive land features means those natural features of land that are characterized by elements such as wetlands as defined herein and adjacent drainage areas important to the natural function of the wetlands steep slopes at least 18 percent slope floodplains and floodways natural prairie plant areas and significant tree stands said tree stands consisting of overstory hardwood species trees with a mature height exceeding 30 feet said species including oak maple linden hickory and evergreen species such as pine spruce and fir environmentally sensitive slopes means naturally occurring slope features prior to development or land alteration with the following characteristics 1 steep slope 18 percent25 percent managed development allowed  2 critical slope 25 percent40 percent restricted or limited development allowed if engineering designs are deemed acceptable  3 protected slopes 40 percent or more no development allowed final plat means the map or plan of record of a subdivision and any accompanying material as described in this chapter flood hazard area and 500year floodplain mean any area subject to flooding by a twotenths percent 02 percent probability flood otherwise referred to as a 500 year flood  as designated by the state department of natural resources or the federal emergency management agency of the united states department of homeland security the flood hazard area is made up of two components the floodway area and the floodway fringe area floodplain buildable area means that portion of the lot remaining after the minimum yard area requirements ie setbacks of the zoning chapter have been met and shall not include that portion of the property within the 500year floodplain floodway  which is part of the flood hazard area or 100year floodplain means the channel of a river or other watercourse and the adjacent lands that must be reserved and protected in order to discharge and convey the waters of a 100 year flood event without cumulatively raising the waterway surface elevation more than one foot the floodway is that area designated by the official flood boundary and floodway map for the city floodway fringe means that portion of the 100year one percent flood and 500year 02 percent flood floodplain extending beyond the floodway boundary these boundaries are illustrated on the officially adopted flood boundary and floodway map for the city governing body means the city council of the city of cedar falls iowa improvements  also meaning required public infrastructure means changes to land necessary to prepare it for building sites including but not limited to grading the city lot means a tract of land represented and identified by number or letter designation on an official plat a lot not an outlot identified on an official plat will be presumed to be that portion of the plat that is intended for new building development lot corner means a lot situated at the intersection of two streets lot double frontage means any lot which is not a corner lot which abuts two streets on two sides major subdivision means all subdivisions not classified as minor subdivisions including but not limited to subdivisions of three or more lots or any size subdivision requiring any new street or extension of local government public service or utility facilities street extension or the creation of any public improvements metes and bounds means the method used to describe a tract of land that uses distances and angles distances and bearings or describes the boundaries of the parcel by reference to physical features of the land minor subdivision and minor plat means any subdivision of land which results in the creation of at least one potentially developable parcel as determined by city staff said subdivision shall contain no more than three lots including the remaining portion of the original parcel fronting on an existing street not involving any new public street or road extension or construction and not involving the extension of municipal facilities or the creation of any public improvement and not adversely affecting the remainder of the parcel or adjoining property and not in conflict with any provision or portion of the master plan official map zoning chapter or this chapter in general deed transfers of smaller unbuildable parcels of land between property owners will not be considered a minor plat in certain situations a reconfiguration of existing lots or property lines on existing lots may not result in creation of any new developable lots however said reconfiguration of lot lines may result in the need for added utility easements or possible relocation of certain existing municipal service facilities in these cases a minor plat will be required in order to establish and record proper utility line locations or utility easements a minor plat shall also be considered to be a final plat for purposes of review approval and recording of the approved minor plat nonresidential subdivision means a subdivision the intended use of which is other than residential such as a commercial or industrial use such subdivision shall comply with the applicable provisions of this chapter official plat means either an auditors plat or a major or minor subdivision plat that meets the requirements of iowa  and that has been filed for record in the offices of the recorder auditor and assessor outlot means an area of a subdivision plat that is reserved or set aside for some purpose other than new building construction or public street use and is identified on the plat as an outlot or separate tract owner means the legal entity holding title to the property being subdivided or such representative as is fully and legally empowered to act on the owners behalf the owner may also be known as the subdivider planning commission means the future intended usage maintenance and ownership soils report also geotechnical soils report means a report prepared by a licensed geotechnical engineer or a registered civil engineer experienced in soils engineering a report that provides an understanding of soil conditions affecting the site the report evaluates projects where foundations are supported by fill locations with high groundwater tables steep slopes or areas within floodplains when these conditions are present a geotechnical soils report shall be required by the city engineer street means public property not an alley intended for vehicular circulation in appropriate contexts the term street may refer to the rightofway bounded by the property lines of such public property or may refer to the paving installed within such rightofway street arterial major or minor arterial means a street primarily intended to carry large volumes of traffic from one part of the city to another and not intended to provide access to abutting property via curb cuts for private driveways arterial streets are characterized by relatively few intersections with other streets said streets must be established with a dedicated public rightofway area measuring at least one 100 feet in width street collector means a street primarily designed to collect traffic from residential streets and to provide a linkage to arterial streets collector streets must be established with a dedicated public rightofway area measuring at least 80 feet in width private driveway curb cut access points are to be limited or consolidated upon review and approval by the city engineer street residential subcollector means a street primarily designed to provide access to individual building lots with frequent drivewaycurb cut access points and frequent intersections with other residential streets said street providing an access route to nearby collector streets all such residential streets must be established with a dedicated rightofway area measuring at least 60 feet in width unless a waiver from this requirement is granted by the city council subdivider means the owner of the property being subdivided or such other person or entity legally empowered to act on the owners behalf subdivision means the division of land into two or more parts for the purpose whether immediate or future of transfer of ownership andor building development the term subdivision when appropriate to the context may refer to the process of subdividing or to land subdivided the term subdivision shall also apply to proposals to establish public roadways or public rightsofway for dedication to the city however the sale or exchange of small parcels of land to or between the owners of adjacent platted lots ie deed transfers where such sale or shall not be considered a subdivision subdivision agent means any person who represents or acts for or on behalf of a subdivider or owner in selling leasing or developing or offering to sell lease or graphic representation of the subdivision of land prepared by a state licensed land surveyor having a number or letter designation for each lot tract or outlot within the plat and a succinct name or title that is unique for the county where the land is located traffic study or traffic report means a study prepared by a licensed transportation engineer or registered civil engineer experienced in transportation engineering the study evaluates the existing transportation system serving a particular area and identifies any improvements necessary to maintain or improve the level of service of the transportation system typical components of a study include data collection existing and projected traffic volumes necessary improvements impacts upon private properties and structures alternate alignments physical constraints and roadway design criteria to be utilized traffic studies shall be required when the city engineer determines that known or suspected traffic conflict issues are   12132010 improvements a required the owner shall at the owners expense install and construct all improvements required by this chapter all required improvements shall be installed and constructed in accordance with the design standards established for such improvements by the city and cedar falls utilities cfu and as shown on the approved preliminary plat b inspection all improvements shall be inspected to ensure compliance with the requirements of this chapter the cost of such inspection shall be borne by the subdivider and shall be the actual cost of the inspection to the city c minimum improvements the improvements set forth below for all proposed subdivision plats shall be considered the minimum improvements necessary to protect the public health safety and welfare 1 streets a the owner of land being plattedsubdivided shall provide the grading of the entire street rightofway alley or public place and provide appropriate paving including curb and gutter on all streets all streets or alleys shall be of such width and shall be so constructed as to meet the standards of the city and be in compliance with state law if any street is established with boulevards or divided lanes that incorporate natural landscaping private entry signs or other optional decorative components desired by the subdivider said street must be established with adequate provision for future maintenance of said landscaped area and other private components by the subdivider or property owners association within the subdivision plat area unless the city agrees to assume maintenance responsibilities these provisions relating to boulevard establishment and maintenance must be outlined in the subdivision deed of dedication or statement of restrictions and shall be subject to approval by the city council b under appropriate circumstances the city may require as a condition for approval of the plat dedication and improvement of a street having a width greater than necessary to meet the needs of the platted area but necessary to complete the city street system as it relates to both the area being platted and other areas in such event the city shall pay the subdivider the difference in cost of improving the wider street and the street width reasonable to meet the foreseeable needs of the subdivision taken alone the streets shall upon final approval by the city engineer and acceptance by the city become the property of the city in order to provide a continuous street system that will serve adjacent properties in the future all streets shall be constructed to the outer or perimeter boundary of the plat area to allow for the future extension of said street to adjacent properties an adequate turnaround area at the end of said streets as determined by the city engineer must be provided and maintained by the subdivider until a connecting street is improved dedicated and accepted by the city council a waiver of the requirement of street construction to the outer boundary of the plat area may be granted by the city council in consideration of special circumstances upon the recommendation of the city engineer in such cases of waiver adequate easements must be provided in anticipation of future street extension 2 sanitary sewer system a the owner of the land being platted shall make adequate provision for the disposal of sanitary sewage from the platted area with due regard being given to present or reasonably foreseeable needs there shall be constructed at the subdividers expense a sanitary sewer system including all necessary pumping stations pumping equipment manholes and all other necessary or desirable appurtenances to provide for the discharge of sanitary sewage from all lots or parcels of land within the platted area to a connection with the citys sanitary sewer system the sanitary sewer system shall be constructed in accordance with the plans and specifications of the city and at the sewer grades as established by the subdividers engineer and reviewed and approved by city staff in order to provide for the future extension of sanitary sewer service to adjacent properties the sanitary sewer system shall be installed and constructed to the outer or perimeter boundaries of the proposed subdivision area a waiver of the requirement of sanitary sewer construction to the outer boundary of the plat area may be granted by the city council in consideration of special circumstances upon the recommendation of the city engineer in such cases of waiver adequate easements must be provided in anticipation of future sewer extension the developer shall pay any sanitary sewer tapping fees that may be required by the city said tapping fees must be paid at the time of final plat approval by the city council b under appropriate circumstances the city may require as a condition for approval of the plat installation of a sanitary sewer that is larger than necessary to meet the needs of the platted area but necessary to complete the city sanitary sewer system as it relates to both the area being platted and other areas in such event the city shall pay the subdivider the difference in cost of the pipe and installation between the sewer required for the subdivision plat and the larger sewer structure necessary to serve the larger area beyond the boundaries of the plat the abovementioned facilities for the collection and disposal of sanitary sewage from the platted area shall upon final approval and acceptance by the city become the property of the city and shall be established within the public street rightofway or within public easements of sufficient width to allow adequate access for future maintenance repair and reconstruction of said facilities including excavation 3 storm sewer system the owner of land being platted shall install and construct a storm sewer system adequate to serve the plat area the storm sewer system shall be extended to the outer or perimeter boundaries of the proposed subdivision plat area for the purpose of future extension to adjacent properties a waiver of the requirement of storm sewer construction to the outer boundary of the plat area may be granted by the city council in consideration of special circumstances upon the recommendation of the city engineer in such cases of waiver adequate easements must be provided in anticipation of future sewer extension a under appropriate circumstances the city may require as a condition for approval of the plat installation of a storm sewer system that is larger than necessary to meet the needs of the platted area but necessary to complete the city storm sewer system as it relates to both the area being platted and other areas in such event the city will pay the subdivider the difference in cost of the pipe and installation between the sewer required for the subdivision plat and the larger sewer structure necessary to serve the larger area beyond the boundaries of the plat b the sewers shall upon inspection approval and acceptance by the city become the property of the city and said sewers shall be established within the public street rightofway or within public easements of sufficient width to allow adequate access for future maintenance repair and reconstruction of said facilities including excavation in the storm sewer design phase consideration shall be given to alternatives and principles of stormwater management such as conservation design principles or in conformance with the provisions of a stormwater management plan if such plan has been adopted by the city 4 stormwater of said water distribution system to the outer or perimeter boundaries of the proposed subdivision plat area for the purpose of future extension to adjacent properties and shall connect the same to the existing municipal water distribution system extension of the water maindistribution system to the outer boundary of the subdivision plat may be waived by the city council and cedar falls easements required easements shall be established when specified by city officials including city utilities personnel for purposes of providing access to or use of various public facilities including but not limited to municipal utilities sewers drainageways trails public access ways or any other such designated easement areas all said easements shall remain open without any obstruction and no building structures of any kind whether permanent temporary or portable shall be permitted within said easement areas all easement areas shall be free of building obstructions and made accessible in order to allow ease of entry and permit repair and maintenance activities as needed within said easement area property line fences landscaping materials or driveways may be installed in said easement areas upon condition that all said components or obstructions shall be removed at the expense of the property owner in case of repair maintenance installation or excavation in the easement area all language as specified by city officials 1 public utilities where alleys are not provided or where otherwise required by the present or future placement of public utilities utility easements of not less than ten feet in width shall be granted by the owner along rear and where necessary along front or side lot lines for public utility requirements except where prohibited by topography such easements shall be centered on lot lines easements of greater width may be required along lot lines or across lots when necessary for the placement and maintenance of utilities no buildings or structures except as necessary for utilities shall be permitted on such easements 2 easements along streams and watercourses wherever any stream or surface watercourse is located in an area that is standards set forth in this chapter shall be considered the minimum standards necessary to protect the public health safety and general welfare b land suitability no land shall be built upon which is found to be unsuitable for building construction by reason of flooding ponding poor drainage adverse soil conditions adverse geological formations unsatisfactory topography or other conditions likely to be harmful to the public health safety or general welfare unless such unsuitable conditions are corrected to the satisfaction of the city other land features that shall be deemed to be undevelopable shall be any that are judged to be an environmentally sensitive land feature including wetlands and adjacent drainage areas important to the natural function of the wetlands steep slopes natural prairie areas and significant tree stands these land features shall be identified and evaluated as to their environmentally sensitive importance by an environmental report to be provided by the owner if land is found to be unsuitable for subdivision for any of the reasons cited in this section the city council shall state its reasons in writing and afford the subdivider an opportunity to present data regarding such unsuitability thereafter the city council may reaffirm modify or withdraw its determination regarding such unsuitability c lands subject to flooding any portion of a proposed subdivision or plat that encroaches into or incorporates into the plat any portion of the floodway zone of the 100year flood hazard area ie 100year floodplain said floodway zone shall be shown on the plat as an unbuildable tract or outlot and shall not be shown as part of any platted building lot or public street or as contributing to minimum required lot area of any proposed building lot in appropriate circumstances bridges or stream crossings may be approved subject to iowa department of natural resources dnr review and approval clearly stated restrictions or provisions permanently prohibiting any disturbances of said floodway zone relating to activities such as excavation landscaping placement of fill material establishment of building structures fences parking lots or other similar facilities shall be stated in the subdivision deed of dedication and in any document transferring ownership to said tract or outlot such provision shall be made permanent by the owner granting a perpetual easement in favor of the city and the general public in the nature of a permanent floodway easement which shall be established across the floodway area for purposes of protecting the floodway zone perpetually from development or disturbance it is intended that all floodway zones shall remain in open green space andor shall be used for a passive public purpose with only such minimum level of disturbance as may be permitted subject to city review and approval furthermore with respect to areas of the 100year one percent or 500year 02 percent flood hazard area extending beyond the floodway zone ie floodway fringe areas no subdivision shall contain a lot or part of a lot or property intended for new building construction that is either wholly or partially located within the 500year flood hazard area and outside or beyond the floodway zone provided however that the subdivision may include newlycreated lots with a floodplain buildable area outside of the 500year flood boundary and provided further that the 500year floodplain does not encompass more than 25 percent of the newly created lot as provided in section 26177c said floodway fringe areas may be used for open space uses such as parks playgrounds gardens and parking lots no building structures including dwellings commercial buildings storage sheds or garages are to be allowed in the 500year floodplain area d wetlands no portion of a proposed subdivision or plat shall establish building lots streets or other facilities wholly or partially in areas that are identified as wetlands or contain characteristics of wetlands as defined herein or as defined by the united states army corps of engineers all such wetland areas shall be preserved and protected along with any adjacent stream or drainage area that is necessary to the natural function of said wetland no said wetland or nearby stream or drainage channel shall be shown on the plat as part of any developable lot for purposes of satisfying minimum required lot area all such wetland and corresponding drainage areas must be identified and shown on the subdivision plat as a separate undevelopable tract or outlot with provisions outlined in the deed of dedication and in any document transferring ownership of said tract or outlot with clearly stated provisions permanently prohibiting any disturbances of said wetland and adjacent stream or drainage channel relating to excavation landscaping placement of fill material establishment of building structures fences parking lots or other facilities such provisions shall be made permanent by the owner granting a perpetual easement in favor of the city and the general public in the nature of protecting said wetland area perpetually from development or disturbance all natural vegetation associated with the wetland and adjacent stream or drainage area must be maintained furthermore said wetland area and where appropriate any adjacent stream and drainage area shall be protected with a permanent drainagewetland easement so as to ensure no future disturbance or alteration of said wetland and drainage area in appropriate circumstances certain wetland areas may be deemed to be of lesser quality or to be less critical wetlands by an approved environmental report in which cases said lesser quality or less critical wetlands may be removed via an approved mitigation approval process united states army corps of engineers along with approval by the city council upon recommendation by the city engineer e plat to conform to comprehensive plan the arrangement character extent width grade and location of all streets and the general nature and extent of the lots and land uses proposed shall conform to the comprehensive plan of the city provided such plan has been adopted by the city  and shall conform to other plans including but not limited to a major street plan a sanitary sewer system plan or a parks trails and open space plan provided such plan has been adopted by the city f construction standards for improvements in addition to the standards set forth in this chapter the city engineer shall from time to time prepare and the city council shall from time to time adopt by resolution technical standards for the construction of public improvements such technical standards for public improvements shall contain the minimum acceptable specifications for the construction of public improvements such technical standards may vary for classes of improvements giving due regard to the classification of streets or other improvements and the extent and character of the area served by the improvements upon adoption by the city council by resolution such technical standards for public improvements shall have the same force and effect as if they were fully set forth herein g parks and open space all residential subdivisions shall be so designed as to meet the neighborhood park and open space needs of its residents such needs may be met by dedication and acceptance of public park land andor by reservation by covenant of private open space provided there shall exist sufficient covenants running with the land to ensure adequate maintenance by the property owners benefiting from such open space h parks and school sites reserved if a tract being subdivided includes lands proposed to be parks or school sites in the comprehensive plan or other official plan of the city the owner shall indicate such areas on the plat and shall make provisions for reservation of said sites i special development area sda in those areas where a proposed subdivision plat incorporates special or unique environmentally sensitive land features such as floodways floodplains wetland areas and adjacent stream or drainage areas steep slopes highly erodible soils prairie areas or significant tree areas all said areas judged to be worthy of special protection and preservation a special development area may be designated by the city council upon recommendation by the planning and zoning commission a decision to allow a special development area shall be accompanied by evidence that the developer is unable to meet intended development goals due to unusual environmental features present on the property the special development area shall afford to the subdivider an opportunity to alter the subdivision plat in such a manner that preserves and protects the identified environmentally sensitive areas while accommodating to the maximum extent that is practicable the density of uses envisioned by the subdivider only those land uses permitted in the zoning district shall be permitted one hundred percent replacement or fulfillment of the subdividers subdivision goals ie creation of maximum number of building lots is not ensured or guaranteed by this provision the accommodations that may be considered by the city council as recommended by the commission are reduced lot areas lot widths lot depths and reduced building setback requirements particularly relating to rear yard and side yard setback requirements allowance of increased building height and also including minor reductions to onsite parking requirements specified in the zoning chapter along with possible reduced street widths reduced street widths are to be considered only in extremely unusual circumstances as a general rule exceptions to lot area lot width lot depth or building setback requirements are to be no less than 75 percent of the normal requirement for the district in which the development is located ie up to 25 percent reduction parking requirement reductions including certain design standards such as parking stall dimensions or driveway widths shall be kept to a minimum and shall be allowed only the extent that such a reduction shall not create traffic or parking problems these accommodations may be achieved cluster development plan which sets aside and preserves the identified environmentally sensitive areas and establishes a plan for the development to occur in a more compact cluster development scheme on the remaining land area within the proposed subdivision a special development area plan must be accompanied by a development agreement between the owner and the city that outlines the special accommodations provisions and exceptions to normally required standards the agreement must also identify the key environmentally sensitive land features to be preserved and protected and how those components will be maintained and protected in the future    12132010   1052015 secs 2072030 acquired by the city or any city agency for use by the city    12132010 required scale a minor plat required in this article shall be drawn to a scale of 100 feet to one inch or larger    12132010 establish a special development area sda prior to or in conjunction with minor plat approval in appropriate cases the requirement for submittal of an environmental report may be waived by city staff if it is clear that the proposed minor plat is merely revising property boundaries and where no new building construction is anticipated or on properties already developed where it is clearly evident of development to be in statement of plat the city planning and zoning commission and the city council may require that certain minimum regulations regarding type and character of subdivision development be incorporated in the owners statement or deed of dedication such regulations shall be intended to protect the character and development of the platted subdivision as well as that of the surrounding development a statement of character shall generally refer to the intended uses to be established in the proposed subdivision and may refer to variables such as land uses building square footage building setbacks size or height of structures or other physical characteristics of the intended development the term character does not refer to plat details such as lot sizes lot line locations or other technical details outlined on the proposed subdivision plat    12132010 improvements  bond or cash required a before the final plat of any subdivided area shall be approved and recorded the subdivider shall make and install the improvements required in this section to the specifications and satisfaction of the city engineer b in lieu of final completion of the required improvements and before the final plat is finally approved by the city council the owner shall enter into a contract with the city to ensure the completion of the improvements within a specific time the performance of such contract shall be secured by the filing of a cash escrow account or payment and performance bond which must be in the name of the owner said financial security instruments cash escrow account or payment and performance bond are to be approved by the city council the payment and performance bond or cash escrow account shall be not less than the estimated cost of the improvements plus a design cost figure as estimated by the city engineer the cash escrow account must be established in a city account with a financial institution where said city account exists no letters of credit or other forms of financial statements will be accepted in place of an acceptable payment and performance bond or cash escrow account c maintenance bond required prior to city council approval of the final plat the owner shall submit to the city engineer a maintenance bond in a form acceptable to the city engineer that will provide for protection of the city against future liability for structural failure of any required public infrastructure including streets sewers utility lines or any other such public infrastructure required as part of final plat approval for a period of three years the maintenance bond must be in the name of the owner only the threeyear maintenance bond shall go into effect when the required public infrastructure is installed and accepted by the city the bond must provide 100 percent coverage of all infrastructure costs or in an amount up to but not to exceed 100 percent cost estimates as recommended by the city engineer in the event of any structural failure of any public infrastructure component following city acceptance of the infrastructure the owner shall be responsible for the correction of any structural failures and maintenance requirements failing which the maintenance bond shall be used for the repair of all such structural failures and maintenance requirements following repair and construction of any failed infrastructure component or elements the city engineer shall determine whether the threeyear bond shall be renewed or extended beyond the original threeyear bond period in the event of major structural failures the maintenance bond shall be renewed if recommended by the city engineer for a new threeyear period from the date of repair for that portion of the public improvements involved in the structural failure and repair d building permits no building permits or foundation permits for new building construction or construction of other private facilities such as parking lots within the proposed subdivision shall be issued until the final plat has been recorded at the county courthouse however site grading installation of required public infrastructure or improvements or installation of stormwater management structures or other structures necessary to protect environmentally sensitive land features as approved by the city engineer may be installed prior to final plat approval and in accordance with the approved preliminary plat specifications e occupancy permits no occupancy permit shall be allowed or issued for any building or structure constructed within the subdivision plat and intended for private use until all improvements and required public infrastructure are satisfactorily completed and formally accepted by the city council unless a request for occupancy by the owner is specifically allowed by the city council f public services no public services by city agencies such as snow plowing refuse collection or other similar activities shall be provided to the proposed subdivision until all required public infrastructure and improvements are satisfactorily completed and formally accepted by the city council or until a special contract to furnish such services at the sole cost of the subdivider is approved by the city council g the required improvements are as follows 1 street grading and surfacing all streets shall be filled or excavated to the established grade and surfaced to the specifications of the city engineer for a minimum width as determined by the city engineer 2 sewers where the subdivision lies within 500 feet of an existing sanitary sewer and shall provide within the subdivision the sanitary sewer system including sewage pumping stations if required to make the sewer accessible to each lot in the subdivision sanitary sewer systems shall be approved by the council and the state board of health and the construction supervised by the city engineer adequate provisions shall be made for the disposal of stormwater in accordance with ordinance chapter 24 subject to the approval of the council and to the satisfaction of the city engineer 3 other street improvements the city planning and zoning commission and the council may also require certain other street improvements including the installation of sidewalks water mains curbing paving or other street surfacing on any or all streets such improvements to be installed in accordance with the specifications approved by the council and under the supervision of the city engineer 4 underground installation of utilities required all electrical telephone communication street lighting traffic signals television wires and cables and any other public utility or associated service providing service within any such subdivision shall be installed entirely underground in accordance with city ordinances and the rules regulations and specifications of the public utility or agency providing such service h the subdivider shall furnish information that satisfactory arrangements have been made with the serving public utility or agency i the city planning and zoning commission may recommend to the council after obtaining approval from the serving public utility or agency that underground requirements may be waived if topographical soil or other conditions make such installation unreasonable j for the purposes of this section appurtenances and associated equipment such as but not limited to surface mounted transformers concealed ducts pedestal mounted terminal boxes and meter cabinets may be placed aboveground as the regulations and policy of the serving public utility provide k poles without overhead wires shall be permitted for street light poles fire alarm boxes traffic signals civil defense alarms or other municipal equipment installed under the direction of the city council    12132010 soil erosion control plans following preliminary plat approval the subdivider shall not begin the installation and construction of said necessary improvements until an erosion control plan is submitted and approved by the city engineer the erosion control plan shall strive to limit soil erosion from natural forces such as wind and rain and control stormwater runoff rates during the course of construction of public improvements requirements outlined in chapter 24 must be adhered to dust control measures shall be employed during all phases of construction appropriate soil erosion control measures as specified by the city engineer shall be installed before on site construction begins    12132010 parks recreational areas where within the subdivision for park playground or other recreational purposes    12132010 subdivider to provide drainage dedicate easement in presence of streams etc whenever any stream or surface chapter 24 and shall also provide and dedicate to the city an easement along such streams and watercourses meeting the approval of the city council said steams or watercourses shall not be altered or obstructed in any way by any structure landscaping fencing regrading or other activities not specifically allowed by the city engineer    12132010 lot lines all side lines of lots shall be at right angles to straight street lines or radial to curved street lines unless a variation to this rule will give a better street and lot plan double frontage shall be avoided    12132010 required lot dimensions the minimum dimensions for lots in a subdivision shall be 60 feet for width as measured at the front property line unless the city engineer specifically allows a reduced frontage of no less than 40 feet on certain lots with curvilinear frontages minimum lot widths may also be reduced to no less than 40 feet in those districts where the zoning chapter does not specify a minimum lot width requirement the minimum required lot depth shall be 100 feet for depth except when parallel streets existing prior to  are not less than 170 feet and not more than 200 feet apart in which case lots may be 85 feet in depth in no case shall a lot that is to be used for residential purposes contain less area than is required by the lot area regulation of the zoning district in which the property is located these requirements may be waived by the city council upon recommendation by the planning and zoning commission in the event that a proposed subdivision or portion of a proposed subdivision is determined to be a sda where certain environmentally sensitive land features have been identified in those cases only minimum required standards with respect to lot width lot area and building setbacks may be waived to provide the subdivider an opportunity to protect the environmentally sensitive land features and to still achieve all or most of the desired development density or capacity on the remaining property in conformance with section 206    12132010 corner lots corner lots in subdivisions at street intersections and at all other points likely to be dangerous shall have a radius of not less than 15 feet at the street corner on businesscommercial lots a chord may be substituted for the circular arc corner lots shall not be less than 80 feet in width unless the city engineer determines that a lesser lot width can be allowed in special circumstances in those cases where a sda has been established corner lot dimensions may be reduced provided that sufficient lot area is provided for new building development in consideration of required setback and street intersection sight vision requirements for said lots in accordance with the recommendation of the city engineer the depth of such building lines is greater than those required by the zoning chapter b provisions shall be made in the owners statement requiring all building structures whether enclosed or unenclosed to be established no closer to the lot line than allowed by the specified building lines whether required by the zoning chapter or established by the plat greater than zoning chapter requirements    12132010 subdivisions to allow opening extending of streets  easements may be required a where a parcel of land is subdivided into larger tracts than ordinarily used for building lots streets may at the discretion of the city council be made a requirement of the plat    12132010 relation of streets to adjoining street systems new subdivisions shall make provisions for the citys plan  intersecting parallel streets a the street system of a subdivision shall be so arranged to comply as far as practicable with the major street plan of the city providing such a plan is in force b intersecting streets if possible shall be near 90 degree angles to each other no street shall be parallel or approximately parallel to a railroad unless it is 150 feet or more from the line of the railroad rightofway    12132010 street rightofway width a the widths for major street rightsofway in subdivisions shall conform to the widths designated on the major street plan of the city or feet the minimum rightofway width for collector streets shall be 80 feet c the minimum required paving width of all streets in new subdivisions shall be 31 feet from back of curb to back of curb unless a lesser paving width is specifically authorized by the city council upon recommendation by the city engineer and the planning and zoning commission in certain situations ie arterial streets or culdesac streets longer than 600 feet required paving width shall be greater than 31 feet as specified by the city engineer    12132010 street grades street grades if practical shall not exceed six percent for major streets and ten percent for other streets and no grade shall be less than onehalf of one percent    12132010 street names and subdivision names a street names streets in subdivisions that are obviously in alignment with other streets already existing and named in the same or adjoining subdivision shall bear the name of the preexisting streets however in situations where there are clear divisions or separations between subdivisions by virtue of major street intersection separations or other physical barriers an alternative street name may be approved by the city council upon recommendation by the planning and zoning commission provided that said alternative street naming scheme will not cause undue confusion to the public or to public safety personnel such as police ambulance and fire services in all other cases street names shall not duplicate existing street names in the city and names similar to existing street names in the city shall not be permitted b subdivision names all proposed subdivisions must be named an addition in the city subdivision names must be unique and not similar to any other subdivision name in the city or in the county all subdivision names must be approved in advance of final plat approval by the county auditor as required by iowa 111e furthermore when multiple phases of subdivisions of land are proposed utilizing the same identifying name the first phase of subdivision shall be known as the first addition with each subsequent phase identified with a sequential number    12132010 alleys the minimum width of an and heat mains utility easements may also be required along front property lines easements of a greater width may be required along lot lines or across lots where necessary for the extension of main division 2  partial exemptions for industrial property exemption granted  statutory authority there is hereby provided a partial exemption from property taxation of the actual value added to industrial real estate by the new construction of industrial real estate researchservice facilities warehouses distribution centers and the acquisition of or improvement to machinery and equipment assessed as real estate pursuant to iowa a11e    762015 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning distribution center means a building or structure used primarily for the storage of goods which are intended for subsequent shipment to retail outlets the term distribution center does not mean a building or structure used primarily to store raw agricultural products used primarily by a manufacturer to store goods to be used in the manufacturing process used primarily for the storage of petroleum products or used for the retail sale of goods new construction means new buildings and structures and includes new buildings and structures which are constructed as additions to existing buildings and structures the term new construction does not include reconstruction of an existing building or structure which does not constitute complete replacement of an existing building or structure or refitting of an existing building or structure unless the reconstruction of an existing building or structure is required due to economic obsolescence and the reconstruction is necessary to implement recognized industry standards for the manufacturing and processing of specific products and the reconstruction is required for the owner of the building or structure to continue to competitively manufacture or process those products which determination shall receive prior approval from the city council upon the recommendation of the state economic development authority research service facilities means a building or group of buildings devoted primarily to research and development activities including but not limited to the design and production or manufacture of prototype products for experimental use and corporateresearch services which do not have a primary purpose of providing on site services to the public warehouse means a building or structure used as a public warehouse for the storage of goods pursuant to iowa art 7 iowa et seq except that it does not mean a building or structure used primarily to store raw agricultural products or from which goods are sold at retail    762015 new machinery and equipment new machinery and equipment as referred to in this division means new machinery and equipment assessed as real estate pursuant to iowa a11e unless the machinery or equipment is part of the normal replacement or operating process to maintain or expand the existing operational status    762015 determination of amount of exemption the actual value added to industrial real estate for the reasons specified in section 2148 renders the property owner eligible to receive a partial exemption from taxation for a period of five years however if property ceases to be classified as industrial real estate or ceases to be used as a researchservice facility a warehouse or a distribution center the partial exemption for the value added shall not be allowed for subsequent assessment years the term actual value added as used in this division means the actual value added as of the first year for which the exemption is received except that actual value added by improvements to machinery and equipment means the actual value as determined by the assessor as of january 1 of each year for which the exemption is received the amount of actual value added which is eligible to be exempt from taxation shall be as follows 1 for the first assessment year after completion of construction 75 percent 2 for the second assessment year after completion of construction 60 percent 3 for the third assessment year after completion of construction 45 percent 4 for the fourth assessment year after completion of construction 30 percent 5 for the fifth assessment year after completion of construction 15 percent    762015 limitation on amount of exemption the granting of the exemption under this division for new construction constituting complete replacement of an existing building or structure shall not result in the assessed value of the industrial real estate being reduced below the assessed value for the industrial real estate before the start of the new construction added    762015 application filing procedure an application shall be filed for each project resulting in actual value added for which an exemption is claimed under this division the application for exemption shall be filed by the owner of the property with the assessor by february 1 of the assessment year in which the value added is first assessed for taxation applications for exemption shall be made on forms prescribed by the state director of revenue and shall contain information pertaining to the nature of the improvement its cost and other information deemed necessary by the state director of revenue    762015 application for approval prior to construction a person may submit a proposal to the city council to receive prior approval for eligibility for a tax exemption under this division on new construction the city council by ordinance may give its prior approval of a tax exemption for new construction if the new construction is in conformance with the zoning plans for the city the ordinance may be enacted not less than 30 days after holding a public hearing in accordance with iowa 3 such prior approval shall not entitle the owner to exemption from taxation until the new construction has been completed and found to be qualified real estate however if the tax exemption for the new construction is not approved the person may submit an amended proposal to the city council to approve or reject    762015 duration of exemption the partial exemption granted by this division shall be available until such time as this division is repealed by the city council    762015 effect of future repeal on existing exemptions when in the opinion of the city council continuation of the exemption granted by this division ceases to be of benefit to the city the city council may repeal this division but all existing exemptions shall continue until their expiration    762015 ineligibility of property receiving other exemption a property tax exemption under this division shall not be granted if the property for which the exemption is claimed has received any other property exemption authorized by law    762015 telecommunications franchise fees for cable andor video services any provider of cable television andor video services in the city shall remit to the city a franchise fee as provided under iowa a7 in the sum of five percent of gross revenues    12232013 franchise fees affirmed the franchise fees of five percent of gross revenues as imposed under the citys receive or discharge pupils turn on flashing warning lamps at a distance of not less than 300 feet nor more than 500 feet from the point where the pupils are to be received or discharged from the bus if the speed limit at that point is 45 miles per hour or greater and shall turn on flashing warning lamps at a distance of not less than 150 feet from the point where the pupils are to be received or discharged from the bus if the speed limit at that point is less than 45 miles per hour at the point of receiving or discharging pupils the driver of the bus shall bring the bus to a stop turn off the amber flashing warning lamps turn on the red flashing warning lamps and extend the stop arm after receiving or discharging pupils the bus driver shall turn off all flashing warning lamps retract the stop arm and proceed on the route except to the extent that reduced visibility is caused by fog snow or other weather conditions a school bus shall not stop to receive or discharge pupils unless there is at least 300 feet of unobstructed vision in each direction however the driver of a school bus is not required to use flashing warning lamps and the stop arm when receiving or discharging pupils at a designated loading and unloading zone at a school attendance center or at extracurricular or educational activity locations where students exiting the bus do not have to cross the street or highway required to be equipped with flashing warning lights and a stop arm if the school bus provided by an urban transit system is equipped with flashing warning lights and a stop arm the driver of the cross the highway except at designated stops where pupils who must cross the highway may do so at points where there are official traffic control devices or police officers 3 a school bus shall while carrying passengers have its headlights turned on b all pupils shall be received and discharged from the right front entrance of every school bus and if said pupils must cross the highway they shall be required to pass in front of the bus look in both directions and proceed to cross the highway only on signal from the bus driver c the driver of a vehicle including the driver of a vehicle operating on a private road or driveway when meeting a school bus with flashing amber warning lamps shall reduce the vehicles speed to not more than 20 miles per hour and shall bring the vehicle to a complete stop when the school bus stops and the stop signal arm is extended the vehicle shall remain stopped until the stop signal arm is retracted after which time the driver may proceed with due caution the driver of a vehicle including the driver of a vehicle operating on a private road or driveway overtaking a school bus shall not pass a school bus when red or amber warning signal lights are flashing the driver shall bring the vehicle to a complete stop no closer than 15 feet from the school bus when it is stopped and the stop arm is extended and the vehicle shall remain stopped until the stop arm is retracted and the school bus resumes motion d the driver of a vehicle upon a highway providing two or more lanes in each direction need not stop upon meeting a school bus which is division 2  overtaking and passing general passing the following rules shall govern the overtaking and passing of vehicles proceeding in the same direction subject to those limitations exceptions and special rules stated in this division 1 the driver of a vehicle overtaking another vehicle proceeding in the same direction shall pass to the left thereof at a safe distance and shall not again drive to the right side of the roadway until safely clear of the overtaken vehicle 2 except when overtaking and passing on the right is permitted the driver of an overtaken vehicle shall give way to the right in favor of the overtaking vehicle on audible signal and shall not increase the speed of his vehicle until completely passed by the overtaking vehicle 3 any driver of a vehicle that is overtaken by a faster moving vehicle who fails to heed the signal of the overtaking vehicle when it is given under such circumstances that he could by the exercise of ordinary care and observation and precaution hear such signal and who fails to yield that part of the traveled way as provided in this section shall be guilty of a misdemeanor 4 upon proof that a signal was given as contemplated by subsection 3 of this section the burden shall rest upon the accused to prove that he did not hear the signal  overtaking or passing on right a the driver of a vehicle may overtake and pass upon the right of another vehicle which is making or about to make a left turn b unless otherwise prohibited by law the driver of a vehicle on a roadway with unobstructed pavement of sufficient width for two or more lines of traffic moving in the same direction as the vehicle being passed may overtake and pass upon the right of another vehicle which is making or about to make a left turn when such movement can be made in safety c the driver of a vehicle shall not drive off the pavement or upon the shoulder of the roadway or upon the apron or roadway of an intersecting roadway in overtaking or passing on the right or the left  limitations on overtaking on left no vehicle shall be driven to the left side of the center of the roadway in overtaking and passing another vehicle proceeding in the same direction unless such left side is clearly visible and is free of oncoming traffic for a sufficient distance ahead to permit such overtaking and passing to be completely made without interfering with the safe operation of any vehicle approaching from the opposite direction or any vehicle overtaken the overtaking vehicle shall return to the righthand side of the roadway before coming within 300 feet of a vehicle approaching from the opposite direction when traveling on a roadway having a legal speed limit in excess of 30 miles per hour and the overtaking vehicle shall return to the righthand side of the roadway before coming within 100 feet of a vehicle approaching from the opposite direction when traveling on a roadway having a legal speed limit of 30 miles per hour or less street or highway of the city and no person shall aid or abet any motor vehicle speed contest or speed exhibition on any street or highway of the city except that a passenger shall not be considered as aiding and abetting a motor vehicle speed contest or exhibition of speed is defined as one or more persons competing in speed in excess of the applicable speed limit in vehicles on the public streets or highways b any person who violates the provisions of this section shall be guilty of drag racing and upon conviction shall be punished in accordance with section 18  minimum speed no person shall drive a motor vehicle at such a slow speed as to impede or block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic except when reduced speed is necessary for safe operation or in compliance with law police officers are hereby authorized to enforce this provision by directions to drivers and in the event of apparent willful disobedience to this provision and refusal to comply with direction of an officer in accordance with this section the continued slow operation by a driver shall be a misdemeanor  control of vehicle  reduced speed a a person operating a motor vehicle shall have the vehicle under control at all times b a person operating a motor vehicle shall reduce the speed to a reasonable and proper rate 1 when approaching and passing a person walking in the traveled portion of the public highway 2 when approaching and passing an animal which is being led ridden or driven upon a public highway 3 when approaching and traversing a crossing or intersection of public highways or a bridge sharp turn curve or steep descent in a public highway 4 when approaching or passing an emergency warning device displayed in accordance with rules adopted under iowa or an emergency vehicle displaying a revolving or flashing light  operators to drive at prudent speed any person driving a motor vehicle upon the streets of the city shall drive the vehicle at a careful and prudent speed not greater than nor less than is reasonable and proper having due regard to the traffic surface and width of the street and any other condition that is existing and no person shall drive any vehicle upon a street at a speed greater than will permit him to bring it to a stop within the assured clear distance ahead such driver having the right to assume however that all persons using such street will observe the law  state speed limit altered in certain areas it is hereby determined upon the basis of an engineering and traffic investigation that the speed permitted by state law upon those streets or portions thereof described in section 23300 is less than is necessary for safe operation of vehicles thereon by reason of the designation of such streets as us highways or by reason of the designation of such streets as boulevards or by reason of alternating residential and suburban districts and widely spaced intersections and it is hereby declared that the maximum speed limit upon those streets or portions thereof described in section 23300 shall be as therein stated  lawful speed limits established unless otherwise provided by this division or other city ordinances and 1111993   2 2221993   3 9111995   8111997   2 6221998   10121998   2 11132000   11132000   2122001   11262001   2 11252002   2 11252002   2 7142003   9222003   2 8222005   7102006   2 9252006   2222010   2282011   6112012   2 7232012   2 222015   2 3202017   2 2192018   secs 2330123318  reserved division 6  turning movements position for turning from oneway street into private drive the driver of a vehicle intending to turn into a private drive from a oneway street shall do as follows 1 a left turn shall be made from the traveled lane nearest the lefthand curb 2 a right turn shall be made from the traveled lane nearest the righthand curb  obedience to turn signs whenever authorized signs are erected indicating that a turn is required or that no right or left or uturn is permitted no driver of a vehicle shall disobey the directions of any such sign  signals required when turning no person shall turn a vehicle from a direct course upon a street unless and until such movement can be made with reasonable safety and then only after giving a clearly audible signal by sounding the horn if any pedestrian may be affected by such movement or after giving an appropriate signal in the manner provided in this division if any other vehicle may be affected by such movement  turn signal to be continuous  distance of giving signal a signal of intention to turn right or left shall be given continuously during not less than the last 100 feet traveled by the vehicle before turning when the speed limit is 45 miles per hour or less and continuously during not less than the last 300 feet when the speed limit is in excess of 45 miles per hour  signals to be by hand and arm or signal device the signals required under the provisions of this chapter may be given either by means of the hand and arm as provided in this division or by a mechanical or electrical directional signal device or light of a type approved by the state department of transportation  method of giving hand and arm signals all signals required by this chapter which may be given by the hand and arm shall when so given be given from the left side of the vehicle in the following manner 1 left turn hand and arm extended horizontally 2 right turn hand and arm extended upward 3 stop or decrease speed hand and arm extended downward  methods of turning at intersections a the driver of a vehicle intending to turn at an intersection shall do as follows 1 both the approach for a right turn and a right turn shall be made as close as practicable to the righthand curb or edge of the roadway 2 approach for a left turn shall be made in that portion of the right half of the roadway nearest the centerline thereof and after entering the intersection the left turn shall be made so as to depart from the intersection to the right of the centerline of the roadway being entered 3 approach for a left turn from a twoway street into a oneway street shall be made in that portion of the right half of the roadway nearest the centerline thereof and by passing to the right of centerline where it enters the intersection a left turn from a oneway street into a twoway street shall be made from the traveled lane nearest the lefthand curb and by passing to the right of the centerline of the street being entered upon leaving the intersection when both streets are oneway both the approach for a left turn and a right turn shall be made as close as practicable to the lefthand curb or edge of the roadway b when the city has caused markers buttons or signs to be placed within or adjacent to intersections and thereby required and directed that a different course from that specified in this section be traveled by vehicles turning at an intersection and when markers buttons or signs are so placed no driver of a vehicle shall turn a vehicle at an intersection other than as directed and required by such markers buttons or signs  uturns a when signs are posted uturns are permitted 1 at all intersections located on university avenue except at the intersection of university avenue and waterloo road and except at the intersections on university avenue located west of main street  and 2 on hudson road at its intersection with west 12th street such uturns must be made from the left storage lane only such uturns made at any intersection that is governed by traffic control signals shall be made only on a green left turn arrow b uturns are prohibited on division street at the intersections of eighth street tenth street and 12th street c other uturns are permitted only at an intersection  provided however that other uturns are prohibited at the intersections within a business district and at other intersections where there are automatic traffic signals d the driver of a vehicle in an intersection who is intending to make a uturn shall yield the rightofway to all vehicles which are in the intersection or so close thereto as to constitute an immediate hazard such driver having so yielded may proceed to make the uturn with caution    12222003 secs 2332723355  reserved article iv  stopping standing and parking division 1  generally fines for parking violations except as
